cfheader.name: cfheader
cfheader.help: Generates custom HTTP response headers to return to the client.

name.name: name
name.help: Header name Required if statusCode not specified

value.name: value
value.help: HTTP header value

charset.name: charset
charset.help: The character encoding in which to encode the header value.  For more information on character encodings, see: www.w3.org/International/O-charset.html.

statuscode.name: statuscode
statuscode.help: HTTP status code Required if name not specified

cfhtmlhead (text).name: cfhtmlhead
cfhtmlhead (text).help: Writes text to the head section of a generated HTML page. It is useful for embedding JavaScript code, or putting other HTML tags, such as meta, link, title, or base in an HTML page header.

text.name: text
text.help: Text to add to the HEAD area of an HTML page.

cfhtmlhead.name: cfhtmlhead
cfhtmlhead.help: Writes text to the head section of a generated HTML page. It is useful for embedding JavaScript code, or putting other HTML tags, such as meta, link, title, or base in an HTML page header.

text.name: text
text.help: Text to add to the HEAD area of an HTML page.

cfhttp.name: cfhttp
cfhttp.help: Generates an HTTP request and handles the response from the server.

url.name: url
url.help: Address of the resource on the server which will handle the request. The URL must include the hostname or IP address.  If you do not specify the transaction protocol (http:// or https://), CFML defaults to http.  If you specify a port number in this attribute, it overrides any port attribute value.  The cfhttppparam tag URL attribute appends query string attribute-value pairs to the URL.

port.name: port
port.help: Port number on the server to which to send the request. A port value in the url attribute overrides this value. (default: http 80 - https 443)

method.name: method
method.help: * GET Requests information from the server. Any data that the server requires to identify the requested information must be in the URL or in cfhttp type="URL" tags. * POST Sends information to the server for processing. Requires one or more cfhttpparam tags. Often used for submitting form-like data. * PUT Requests the server to store the message body at the specified URL. Use this method to send files to the server. * DELETE Requests the server to delete the specified URL. * HEAD Identical to the GET method, but the server does not send a message body in the response. Use this method for testing hypertext links for validity and accessibility, determining the type or modification time of a document, or determining the type of server. * TRACE Requests that the server echo the received HTTP headers back to the sender in the response body. Trace requests cannot have bodies. This method enables the CFML application to see what is being received at the server, and use that data for testing or diagnostic information. * OPTIONS A request for information about the communication options available for the server or the specified URL. This method enables the CFML application to determine the options and requirements associated with a URL, or the capabilities of a server, without requesting any additional activity by the server.

proxyserver.name: proxyserver
proxyserver.help: The proxy server required to access the URL.

proxyport.name: proxyport
proxyport.help: The port to use on The proxy server.

proxyuser.name: proxyuser
proxyuser.help: The user ID to send to the proxy server.

proxypassword.name: proxypassword
proxypassword.help: The user's password on the proxy server.

username.name: username
username.help: A username. May be required by server.

password.name: password
password.help: A password. May be required by server

useragent.name: useragent
useragent.help: Text to put in the user agent request header. Used to identify the request client software. Can make the CFML application appear to be a browser.

charset.name: charset
charset.help: TThe character encoding of the request, including the URL query string and form or file data, and the response.  For more information on character encodings, see: www.w3.org/International/O-charset.html.

resolveurl.name: resolveurl
resolveurl.help: No does not resolve URLs in the response body. As a result, any relative URL links in the response body do not work. Yes resolves URLs in the response body to absolute URLs, including the port number, so that links in a retrieved page remain functional.

throwonerror.name: throwonerror
throwonerror.help: Yes if the server returns an error response code, throws an exception that can be caught using the cftry and cfcatch or CFML error pages. No does not throw an exception if an error response is returned. In this case, your application can use the cfhttp.StatusCode variable to determine if there was an error and its cause.

redirect.name: redirect
redirect.help: If the response header includes a Location field, determines whether to redirect execution to the URL specified in the field.

timeout.name: timeout
timeout.help: Value, in seconds of the maximum time the request can take. If the timeout passes without a response, CFML considers the request to have failed.

getasbinary.name: getasbinary
getasbinary.help: * No If CFML does not recognize the response body type as text, convert it to a CFML object. * Auto If CFML does not recognize the response body type as text, convert it to CFML Binary type data. * Yes Always convert the response body content into CFML Binary type data, even if CFML recognizes the response body type as text.

result.name: result
result.help: Specifies the name of the variable in which you want the result returned. Default: CFHTTP

delimiter.name: delimiter
delimiter.help: A character that separates query columns. The response body must use this character to separate the query columns.

name.name: name
name.help: Tells ColdFusion to create a query object with the given name from the returned HTTP response body.

columns.name: columns
columns.help: The column names for the query, separated by commas, with no spaces. Column names must start with a letter. The remaining characters can be letters, numbers, or underscore characters (_).  If there are no column name headers in the response, specify this attribute to identify the column names.  If you specify this attribute, and the firstrowasHeader attribute is True (the default), the column names specified by this attribute replace the first line of the response. You can use this behavior to replace the column names retrieved by the request with your own names.  If a duplicate column heading is encountered in either this attribute or in the column names from the response, ColdFusion appends an underscore to the name to make it unique.  If the number of columns specified by this attribute does not equal the number of columns in the HTTP response body, ColdFusion generates an error.

firstrowasheaders.name: firstrowasheaders
firstrowasheaders.help: Determines how ColdFusion processes the first row of the query record set: * yes: processes the first row as column heads. If you specify a columns attribute, ColdFusion ignores the first row of the file. * no: processes the first row as data. If you do not specify a columns attribute, ColdFusion generates column names by appending numbers to the word "column"; for example, "column_1".

textqualifier.name: textqualifier
textqualifier.help: A character that, optionally, specifies the start and end of a text column. This character must surround any text fields in the response body that contain the delimiter character as part of the field value.  To include this character in column text, escape it by using two characters in place of one. For example, if the qualifier is a double-quotation mark, escape it as "".

file.name: file
file.help: Name of the file in which to store the response body.

multipart.name: multipart
multipart.help: Tells ColdFusion to send all data specified by cfhttpparam type="formField" tags as multipart form data, with a Content-Type of multipart/form-data.

clientcertpassword.name: clientcertpassword
clientcertpassword.help: Password used to decrypt the client certificate.

path.name: path
path.help: Required if File is specified. Tells ColdFusion to save the HTTP response body in a file. Contains the absolute path to the directory in which to store the file.

clientcert.name: clientcert
clientcert.help: The full path to a PKCS12 format file that contains the client certificate for the request.

multiparttype.name: multiparttype
multiparttype.help: Allows you to set the multipart header field to related or form-data. By default, the value is form-data

cfhttpparam.name: cfhttpparam
cfhttpparam.help: Allowed inside cfhttp tag bodies only. Required for cfhttp POST operations. Optional for all others. Specifies parameters to build an HTTP request.

type.name: type
type.help: Information type * Header: The parameter specifies an HTTP header. (ColdFusion does not URL encode the header) * Body: Specifies the body of the HTTP request. (ColdFusion does not URL encode the body contents) * XML: Identifies the request as having a content-type of text/xml. Specifies that the value attribute contains the body of the HTTP request. Used to send XML to the destination URL. CFML does not URL encode the XML data. * CGI: Specifies an HTTP header. CFML URL encodes the header by default. * File: Tells CFML to send the contents of the specified file. CFML does not URL encode the file contents * URL: Specifies a URL query string name-value pair to append to the cfhttp url attribute. CFML URL encodes the query string. * FormField: Specifies a form field to send. CFML URL encodes the Form field by default. * Cookie: Specifies a cookie to send as an HTTP header. CFML URL encodes the cookie.

name.name: name
name.help: Variable name for data that is passed. Ignored for Body and XML types. For File type, specifies the filename to send in the request.

value.name: value
value.help: Value of the data that is sent. Ignored for File type. The value must contain string data or data that CFML can convert to a string for all type attributes except Body. Body types can have string or binary values.

file.name: file
file.help: Applies to File type; ignored for all other types. The absolute path to the file that is sent in the request body.

encoded.name: encoded
encoded.help: Specifies if form field or header should be encoded. Applies to FormField and CGI types; ignored for all other types.

mimetype.name: mimetype
mimetype.help: Applies to File type; invalid for all other types. Specifies the MIME media type of the file contents. The content type can include an identifier for the character encoding of the file; for example, text/html; charset=ISO-8859-1 indicates that the file is HTML text in the ISO Latin-1 character encoding.

cfif.name: cfif
cfif.help: Creates simple and compound conditional statements in CFML. Tests an expression, variable, function return value, or string. Used, optionally, with the cfelse and cfelseif tags.

cffinally.name: cffinally
cffinally.help: Used inside a cftry tag. Code in the cffinally block is processed after the main cftry code and, if an exception occurs, the cfcatch code. The cffinally block code always executes, whether or not there is an exception.

cfcontinue.name: cfcontinue
cfcontinue.help: Used within a cfloop tag. Returns processing to the top of a loop.

cfimap.name: cfimap
cfimap.help: Queries an IMAP server to retrieve and manage mails within multiple folders.

password.name: password
password.help: Specifies the password for assessing the usersâ€™ e-mail account.

secure.name: secure
secure.help: Specifies whether the IMAP server uses a Secure Sockets Layer.

action.name: action
action.help: * GetHeaderOnly - Returns the message header information for all retrieved mail. * GetAll - Returns mail. The information includes the message header information, message text, and any attachments. Set the AttachmentPath attribute to retrieve attachments. * Delete - Deletes messages from a folder. * Open - Initiates an open session or connection with the IMAP server. * Close - Terminates the open session or connection with the IMAP server. * MarkRead - Marks all messages read from a folder. * DeleteFolder - Deletes the identified folder. * CreateFolder - Creates a folder in Inbox. * RenameFolder - Renames an existing user-defined folder. * ListAllFolders - Displays a list of all existing folders in the mailbox or under the folder name defined by the Folder attribute. * MoveMail - Moves mail from one folder to another

timeout.name: timeout
timeout.help: Specifies the number of seconds to wait before timing out connection to IMAP server. An error message is displayed when timeout occurs.

messageNumber.name: messageNumber
messageNumber.help: Specifies the message number or a comma delimited list of message numbers for retrieval, deletion, marking mail as read, or moving mails. If you set an invalid message number or range, then it is ignored. If you have specified the UID attribute, then MessageNumber attribute is ignored.

connection.name: connection
connection.help: Required for the following actions: Open and Close - Specifies the variable name for the connection/session. For example, the e-mail login to an IMAP server can be used as the value for the connection. If the server attribute has an invalid IP address or invalid domain name, then the connection fails and ColdFusion returns an error message.

newFolder.name: newFolder
newFolder.help: Specifies the name of the destination folder where all mail move.

uid.name: uid
uid.help: Specifies the unique ID or a comma-delimited list of Uids to retrieve or delete. If you set invalid Uids, then they are ignored.

folder.name: folder
folder.help: For mail actions: Specifies the folder name where messages are searched, retrieved, moved, or deleted. If folder name is invalid, ColdFusion defaults to INBOX. For folder actions: Specifies the folder name that is deleted (DeleteFolder) or created (CreateFolder) or renamed (RenameFolder).

port.name: port
port.help: Specifies the IMAP port number. Use 993 for secured connections.

stoponerror.name: stoponerror
stoponerror.help: Specifies whether or not to ignore the exceptions for this operation. When the value is true, it stops processing, displays an appropriate error.

generateUniqueFileNames.name: generateUniqueFileNames
generateUniqueFileNames.help: Ensures that unique file names are generated for each attachment file. The goal is to avoid name conflicts for attachments that have the same filename.

maxrows.name: maxrows
maxrows.help: Specifies the number of rows to be marked as read, deleted, or moved across folders. When the value is 1, it signals the row determined by StartRow. Any incremental value marks rows starting from the StartRow. If you have specified the UID or MessageNumber attribute, then MaxRows is ignored.

username.name: username
username.help: Specifies the user name. Typically, the user name is same the e-mail login.

startRow.name: startRow
startRow.help: Defines the first row number for reading or deleting. If you have specified the UID or MessageNumber attribute, then StartRow is ignored. You can also specify StartRow for moving mails.

attachmentpath.name: attachmentpath
attachmentpath.help: Required for GetAll action - Specifies the name of the folder where ColdFusion retrieves attachments. If this folder does not exist, ColdFusion creates it.

server.name: server
server.help: Specifies the IMAP server identifier. You can assign a host name or an IP address as the IMAP server identifier. For example, imap.gmail.com.

name.name: name
name.help: Specifies the name for the query object that contains the retrieved message information.

recurse.name: recurse
recurse.help: Specifies whether ColdFusion runs the CFIMAP command in subfolders.

cfimport (taglib).name: cfimport
cfimport (taglib).help: You can use the cfimport tag to import either of the following:  * All CFML pages in a directory, as a tag custom tag library. * A Java Server Page (JSP) tag library. A JSP tag library is a packaged set of tag handlers that conform to the JSP 1.1 tag extension API.

taglib.name: taglib
taglib.help: Tag library URI. The path must be relative to the web root (and start with /), the current page location, or a directory specified in the Administrator CFML mappings page.  A directory in which custom CFML tags are stored. In this case, all the cfm pages in this directory are treated as custom tags in a tag library. A path to a JAR in a web-application; for example, "/WEB-INF/lib/sometags.jar" A path to a tag library descriptor; for example, "/sometags.tld" Note: You must put JSP custom tag libraries in the /WEB-IN/lib directory. This limitation does not apply to CFML pages.

prefix.name: prefix
prefix.help: Prefix by which to access the imported custom CFML tags JSP tags.  If you import a CFML custom tag directory and specify an empty value, "", for this attribute, you can call the custom tags without using a prefix. You must specify and use a prefix for a JSP tag library.

path.name: path
path.help: Path of CFC to be imported

cfimport (path).name: cfimport
cfimport (path).help: You can use the cfimport tag to import either of the following:  * All CFML pages in a directory, as a tag custom tag library. * A Java Server Page (JSP) tag library. A JSP tag library is a packaged set of tag handlers that conform to the JSP 1.1 tag extension API.

taglib.name: taglib
taglib.help: Tag library URI. The path must be relative to the web root (and start with /), the current page location, or a directory specified in the Administrator CFML mappings page.  A directory in which custom CFML tags are stored. In this case, all the cfm pages in this directory are treated as custom tags in a tag library. A path to a JAR in a web-application; for example, "/WEB-INF/lib/sometags.jar" A path to a tag library descriptor; for example, "/sometags.tld" Note: You must put JSP custom tag libraries in the /WEB-IN/lib directory. This limitation does not apply to CFML pages.

prefix.name: prefix
prefix.help: Prefix by which to access the imported custom CFML tags JSP tags.  If you import a CFML custom tag directory and specify an empty value, "", for this attribute, you can call the custom tags without using a prefix. You must specify and use a prefix for a JSP tag library.

path.name: path
path.help: Path of CFC to be imported

cfimport.name: cfimport
cfimport.help: You can use the cfimport tag to import either of the following:  * All CFML pages in a directory, as a tag custom tag library. * A Java Server Page (JSP) tag library. A JSP tag library is a packaged set of tag handlers that conform to the JSP 1.1 tag extension API.

taglib.name: taglib
taglib.help: Tag library URI. The path must be relative to the web root (and start with /), the current page location, or a directory specified in the Administrator CFML mappings page.  A directory in which custom CFML tags are stored. In this case, all the cfm pages in this directory are treated as custom tags in a tag library. A path to a JAR in a web-application; for example, "/WEB-INF/lib/sometags.jar" A path to a tag library descriptor; for example, "/sometags.tld" Note: You must put JSP custom tag libraries in the /WEB-IN/lib directory. This limitation does not apply to CFML pages.

prefix.name: prefix
prefix.help: Prefix by which to access the imported custom CFML tags JSP tags.  If you import a CFML custom tag directory and specify an empty value, "", for this attribute, you can call the custom tags without using a prefix. You must specify and use a prefix for a JSP tag library.

path.name: path
path.help: Path of CFC to be imported

cfinclude (template).name: cfinclude
cfinclude (template).help: Embeds references to CFML pages in CFML. You can embed cfinclude tags recursively. For another way to encapsulate CFML, see cfmodule. (A CFML page was formerly sometimes called a CFML template or a template.)

template.name: template
template.help: A logical path to a CFML page.

runonce.name: runonce
runonce.help: If set to true, template is processed only once in a given request

cfinclude.name: cfinclude
cfinclude.help: Embeds references to CFML pages in CFML. You can embed cfinclude tags recursively. For another way to encapsulate CFML, see cfmodule. (A CFML page was formerly sometimes called a CFML template or a template.)

template.name: template
template.help: A logical path to a CFML page.

runonce.name: runonce
runonce.help: If set to true, template is processed only once in a given request

cfindex.name: cfindex
cfindex.help: Populates a Solr search engine collection with an index of documents on a file system or of CFML query result sets.  A collection must exist before it can be populated.

collection.name: collection
collection.help: Name of a collection that is registered by CFML; for example, "personnel" Name and absolute path of a collection that is not registered by CFML; for example: "e:\collections\personnel"

action.name: action
action.help: abort : Valid if type is DIH. delete: removes collection documents as specified by the key attribute. deltaimport : Valid if type is DIH. fullimport : Valid if type is DIH. purge: deletes all of the documents in a collection. Causes the collection to be taken offline, preventing searches. refresh: deletes all of the documents in a collection, and then performs an update. status : Valid if type is DIH. update: updates a collection and adds key to the index.

type.name: type
type.help: file: using the key attribute value of the query result as input, applies action value to filenames or filepaths. path: using the key attribute value of the query result as input, applies action to filenames or filepaths that pass the extensions filter custom: If action = "update" or "delete": applies action to custom entities in query results.

title.name: title
title.help: * Title for collection * Query column name for type and a valid query name Permits searching collections by title or displaying a separate title from the key

key.name: key
key.help: * Absolute path and filename, if type = "file" * Absolute path, if type = "path" * A query column name (typically, the primary key column name), if type = "custom" * A query column name, if type = any other value  This attribute is required for the actions listed, unless you intend for its value to be an empty string.

body.name: body
body.help: * ASCII text to index * Query column name(s), if name is specified in query  You can specify columns in a delimited list. For example: "emp_name, dept_name, location"

custom1.name: custom1
custom1.help: Custom field in which you can store data during an indexing operation. Specify a query column name for type, and a query name.

custom2.name: custom2
custom2.help: Custom field in which you can store data during an indexing operation. Specify a query column name for type, and a query name.

custom3.name: custom3
custom3.help: Custom field in which you can store data during an indexing operation. Specify a query column name for type, and a query name. (Added in ColdFusion 7)

custom4.name: custom4
custom4.help: Custom field in which you can store data during an indexing operation. Specify a query column name for type, and a query name. (Added in ColdFusion 7)

category.name: category
category.help: A string value that specifies one or more search categories for which to index the data. You can define multiple categories, separated by commas, for a single index.

categoryTree.name: categoryTree
categoryTree.help: A string value that specifies a hierarchical category or category tree for searching. It is a series of categories separated by forward slashes ("/"). You can specify only one category tree.

urlpath.name: urlpath
urlpath.help: If type="file" or "path", specifies the URL path. When the collection is searched with cfsearch, this pathname is prefixed to filenames and returned as the url attribute.

extensions.name: extensions
extensions.help: Delimited list of file extensions that CFML uses to index files, if type = "Path". "*." returns files with no extension.  For example: the following code returns files with a listed extension or no extension: extensions = ".htm, .html, .cfm, .cfml, "*."

query.name: query
query.help: Query against which collection is generated

recurse.name: recurse
recurse.help: Yes: if type = "path", directories below the path specified in key are included in indexing operation

status.name: status
status.help: The name of the structure into which ColdFusion MX returns status information.

prefix.name: prefix
prefix.help: Specifies the location of files to index when the computer that contains the K2 Search Service is not the computer on which you installed ColdFusion, and when you index files with the type attribute set to path.

docboost.name: docboost
docboost.help: Relative ranking number for the document. Higher this number, the document appears with higher ranking in the search results

fieldboost.name: fieldboost
fieldboost.help: Comma-seperated values of fields and their boost factor e.g. field1:10,field2:5

autocommit.name: autocommit
autocommit.help: Flag to indicate if to save indices automatically

datasource.name: datasource
datasource.help: No Help Available

cfinput (name).name: cfinput
cfinput (name).help: Used within the cfform tag, to place radio buttons, check boxes, or text boxes on a form. Provides input validation for the specified control type.

autosuggest.name: autosuggest
autosuggest.help: Specifies entry completion suggestions to display as the user types into a text input. The user can select a suggestion to complete the text entry. The valid value can be either of the following: â€¢ A string consisting of the suggestion values separated by the delimiter specified by the delimiter attribute. â€¢ A bind expression that gets the suggestion values based on the current input text. Valid only for cfinput type="text".

autoSuggestBindDelay.name: autoSuggestBindDelay
autoSuggestBindDelay.help: The minimum time between autosuggest bind expression invocations, in seconds. Use this attribute to limit the number of requests that are sent to the server when a user types. Valid only for cfinput type="text"

autoSuggestMinLength.name: autoSuggestMinLength
autoSuggestMinLength.help: The minimum number of characters required in the text box before invoking a bind expression to return items for suggestion. Valid only for cfinput type="text".

bindAttribute.name: bindAttribute
bindAttribute.help: Specifies the HTML tag attribute whose value is set by the bind attribute. You can only specify attributes in the browserâ€™s HTML DOM tree, not ColdFusion-specific attributes. Ignored if there is no bind attribute. Valid only for cfinput type="text".

bindonload.name: bindonload
bindonload.help: A Boolean value that specifies whether to execute the bind attribute expression when first loading the form. Ignored if there is no bind attribute. Valid only for cfinput type="text".

type.name: type
type.help: The input control type to create: - button: push button. - checkbox: check box. - file: file selector; not supported in Flash. - hidden: invisible control. - image: clickable button with an image. - password: password entry control; hides input values. - radio: radio button. - reset: form reset button. - submit: form submission button. - text: text entry box. - datefield: Flash only; date entry field with an expanding calendar for selecting dates.

label.name: label
label.help: Label to put next to the control on a Flash or XML form. Not used for button, hidden, image, reset, or submit types.

style.name: style
style.help: In HTML or XML format, ColdFusion passes the style attribute to the browser or XML. In Flash format, must be a style specification in CSS format.

class.name: class
class.help: Stylesheet class for form input element.

required.name: required
required.help: *  yes: the field must contain data. * no: allows an empty field.

mask.name: mask
mask.help: A mask pattern that controls the character pattern that users can enter, or that the form sends to ColdFusion. In HTML and Flash for type=text use: - A = [A-Za-z] - X = [A-Za-z0-9] - 9 = [0-9] - ? = Any character - all other = the literal character In Flash for type=datefield use: - D = day; can use 0-2 mask characters. - M = month; can use 0-4 mask characters. - Y = year; can use 0, 2, or 4 characters. - E = day in week; can use 0-4 characters.

validate.name: validate
validate.help: date: verifies format mm/dd/yy. eurodate: verifies date format dd/mm/yyyy. time: verifies time format hh:mm:ss. float: verifies floating point format. integer: verifies integer format. telephone: verifies telephone format ###-###-####. The separator can be a blank. Area code and exchange must begin with digit 1 - 9. zipcode: verifies, in U.S. formats only, 5- or 9-digit format #####-####. The separator can be a blank. creditcard: strips blanks and dashes; verifies number using mod10 algorithm. Number must have 13-16 digits. social_security_number: verifies format ###-##-####. The separator can be a blank. regular_expression: matches input against pattern attribute.

validateat.name: validateat
validateat.help: How to do the validation; one or more of the following: onSubmit, onServer or onBlur. onBlur and onSubmit are identical in Flash forms. For multiple values, use a comma-delimited list. Default: onSubmit

message.name: message
message.help: Message text to display if validation fails

range.name: range
range.help: Minimum and maximum value range, separated by a comma. If type = "text" or "password", this applies only to numeric data.

maxlength.name: maxlength
maxlength.help: Maximum length of text entered, if type=text or password.

pattern.name: pattern
pattern.help: JavaScript regular expression pattern to validate input. ColdFusion uses this attribute only if you specify regex in the validate attribute. Omit leading and trailing slashes.

onvalidate.name: onvalidate
onvalidate.help: Custom JavaScript function to validate user input. The form object, input object, and input object values are passed to the routine, which should return True if validation succeeds, and False otherwise. If used, the validate attribute is ignored.

onerror.name: onerror
onerror.help: Custom JavaScript function to execute if validation fails.

size.name: size
size.help: Size of input control. Ignored, if type=radio or checkbox. If specified in a Flash form, ColdFusion sets the control width pixel value to 10 times the specified size and ignores the width attribute.

value.name: value
value.help: HTML: corresponds to the HTML value attribute. Its use depends on control type. Flash: optional; specifies text for button type inputs: button, submit, and image.

bind.name: bind
bind.help: A Flash bind expression that populates the field with information from other form fields.

checked.name: checked
checked.help: Selects a control. No value is required. Applies if type=radio or checkbox. Default: false

disabled.name: disabled
disabled.help: Disables user input, making the control read-only. To disable input, specify disabled without an attribute or disabled="true". To enable input, omit the attribute or specify disabled="false".

src.name: src
src.help: Applies to Flash button, reset, submit, and image types, and the HTML image type. URL of an image to use on the button. Flash does not support GIF images.

onkeyup.name: onkeyup
onkeyup.help: JavaScript (HTML/XML) or ActionScript (Flash) to run when the user releases a keyboard key in the control.

onkeydown.name: onkeydown
onkeydown.help: JavaScript (HTML/XML) or ActionScript (Flash) ActionScript to run when the user presses a keyboard key in the control.

onmouseup.name: onmouseup
onmouseup.help: JavaScript (HTML/XML) or ActionScript (Flash) to run when the user presses a mouse button in the control.

onmousedown.name: onmousedown
onmousedown.help: JavaScript (HTML/XML) or ActionScript (Flash) to run when the user releases a mouse button in the control.

onchange.name: onchange
onchange.help: JavaScript (HTML/XML) or ActionScript (Flash) to run when the control changes due to user action. In Flash, applies to datefield, password, and text types only.

onclick.name: onclick
onclick.help: JavaScript (HTML/XML) or ActionScript (Flash) to run when the user clicks the control. In Flash, applies to button, checkbox, image, radio, reset, and submit types only.

daynames.name: daynames
daynames.help: A comma-delimited list that sets the names of the weekdays displayed in the calendar. Sunday is the first day and the rest of the weekday names follow in the normal order. Default is: S,M,T,W,Th,F,S

firstdayofweek.name: firstdayofweek
firstdayofweek.help: Integer in the range 0-6 specifying the first day of the week in the calendar, 0 indicates Sunday, 6 indicates Saturday. Default is: 0

monthnames.name: monthnames
monthnames.help: A comma-delimited list of the month names that are displayed at the top of the calendar.

enabled.name: enabled
enabled.help: Flash only: Boolean value specifying whether the control is enabled. A disabled control appears in light gray. The inverse of the disabled attribute. Flash only. Default: true

visible.name: visible
visible.help: Flash only: Boolean value specifying whether to show the control. Space that would be occupied by an invisible control is blank. Default: true

tooltip.name: tooltip
tooltip.help: Flash only: Text to display when the mouse pointer hovers over the control.

width.name: width
width.help: Applies to most Flash types, HTML image type on some browsers. The width of the control, in pixels. For Flash forms, ColdFusion ignores this attribute if you also specify a size attribute value.

height.name: height
height.help: Applies to most Flash types, HTML image type on some browsers. The height of the control, in pixels. The displayed height might be less than the specified size.

delimiter.name: delimiter
delimiter.help: The delimiter to use to separate entries in a static autosuggest list. This attribute is meaningful only if the autosuggest attribute is a string of delimited values.

maxresultsdisplayed.name: maxresultsdisplayed
maxresultsdisplayed.help: The maximum number suggestions to display in the autosuggest list. Valid only for cfinput type="text".

onbinderror.name: onbinderror
onbinderror.help: The name of a JavaScript function to execute if evaluating a bind expression, including an autosuggest bind expression, results in an error. The function must take two attributes: an HTTP status code and a message.

showautosuggestloadingicon.name: showautosuggestloadingicon
showautosuggestloadingicon.help: A Boolean value that specifies whether to display an animated icon when loading an autosuggest value for a text input.

sourcefortooltip.name: sourcefortooltip
sourcefortooltip.help: The URL of a page to display as a tool tip. The page can include HTML markup to control the format, and the tip can include images. If you specify this attribute, an animated icon appears with the text "Loading..." while the tip is being loaded.

typeahead.name: typeahead
typeahead.help: A Boolean value that specifies whether the autosuggest feature should automatically complete a user's entry with the first result in the suggestion list. Valid only for cfinput type="text".

matchContains.name: matchContains
matchContains.help: true, match returned "contains" the query string. Default is false so that only results that "start with" the query string are returned.

cfinput.name: cfinput
cfinput.help: Used within the cfform tag, to place radio buttons, check boxes, or text boxes on a form. Provides input validation for the specified control type.

autosuggest.name: autosuggest
autosuggest.help: Specifies entry completion suggestions to display as the user types into a text input. The user can select a suggestion to complete the text entry. The valid value can be either of the following: â€¢ A string consisting of the suggestion values separated by the delimiter specified by the delimiter attribute. â€¢ A bind expression that gets the suggestion values based on the current input text. Valid only for cfinput type="text".

autoSuggestBindDelay.name: autoSuggestBindDelay
autoSuggestBindDelay.help: The minimum time between autosuggest bind expression invocations, in seconds. Use this attribute to limit the number of requests that are sent to the server when a user types. Valid only for cfinput type="text"

autoSuggestMinLength.name: autoSuggestMinLength
autoSuggestMinLength.help: The minimum number of characters required in the text box before invoking a bind expression to return items for suggestion. Valid only for cfinput type="text".

bindAttribute.name: bindAttribute
bindAttribute.help: Specifies the HTML tag attribute whose value is set by the bind attribute. You can only specify attributes in the browserâ€™s HTML DOM tree, not ColdFusion-specific attributes. Ignored if there is no bind attribute. Valid only for cfinput type="text".

bindonload.name: bindonload
bindonload.help: A Boolean value that specifies whether to execute the bind attribute expression when first loading the form. Ignored if there is no bind attribute. Valid only for cfinput type="text".

type.name: type
type.help: The input control type to create: - button: push button. - checkbox: check box. - file: file selector; not supported in Flash. - hidden: invisible control. - image: clickable button with an image. - password: password entry control; hides input values. - radio: radio button. - reset: form reset button. - submit: form submission button. - text: text entry box. - datefield: Flash only; date entry field with an expanding calendar for selecting dates.

label.name: label
label.help: Label to put next to the control on a Flash or XML form. Not used for button, hidden, image, reset, or submit types.

style.name: style
style.help: In HTML or XML format, ColdFusion passes the style attribute to the browser or XML. In Flash format, must be a style specification in CSS format.

class.name: class
class.help: Stylesheet class for form input element.

required.name: required
required.help: *  yes: the field must contain data. * no: allows an empty field.

mask.name: mask
mask.help: A mask pattern that controls the character pattern that users can enter, or that the form sends to ColdFusion. In HTML and Flash for type=text use: - A = [A-Za-z] - X = [A-Za-z0-9] - 9 = [0-9] - ? = Any character - all other = the literal character In Flash for type=datefield use: - D = day; can use 0-2 mask characters. - M = month; can use 0-4 mask characters. - Y = year; can use 0, 2, or 4 characters. - E = day in week; can use 0-4 characters.

validate.name: validate
validate.help: date: verifies format mm/dd/yy. eurodate: verifies date format dd/mm/yyyy. time: verifies time format hh:mm:ss. float: verifies floating point format. integer: verifies integer format. telephone: verifies telephone format ###-###-####. The separator can be a blank. Area code and exchange must begin with digit 1 - 9. zipcode: verifies, in U.S. formats only, 5- or 9-digit format #####-####. The separator can be a blank. creditcard: strips blanks and dashes; verifies number using mod10 algorithm. Number must have 13-16 digits. social_security_number: verifies format ###-##-####. The separator can be a blank. regular_expression: matches input against pattern attribute.

validateat.name: validateat
validateat.help: How to do the validation; one or more of the following: onSubmit, onServer or onBlur. onBlur and onSubmit are identical in Flash forms. For multiple values, use a comma-delimited list. Default: onSubmit

message.name: message
message.help: Message text to display if validation fails

range.name: range
range.help: Minimum and maximum value range, separated by a comma. If type = "text" or "password", this applies only to numeric data.

maxlength.name: maxlength
maxlength.help: Maximum length of text entered, if type=text or password.

pattern.name: pattern
pattern.help: JavaScript regular expression pattern to validate input. ColdFusion uses this attribute only if you specify regex in the validate attribute. Omit leading and trailing slashes.

onvalidate.name: onvalidate
onvalidate.help: Custom JavaScript function to validate user input. The form object, input object, and input object values are passed to the routine, which should return True if validation succeeds, and False otherwise. If used, the validate attribute is ignored.

onerror.name: onerror
onerror.help: Custom JavaScript function to execute if validation fails.

size.name: size
size.help: Size of input control. Ignored, if type=radio or checkbox. If specified in a Flash form, ColdFusion sets the control width pixel value to 10 times the specified size and ignores the width attribute.

value.name: value
value.help: HTML: corresponds to the HTML value attribute. Its use depends on control type. Flash: optional; specifies text for button type inputs: button, submit, and image.

bind.name: bind
bind.help: A Flash bind expression that populates the field with information from other form fields.

checked.name: checked
checked.help: Selects a control. No value is required. Applies if type=radio or checkbox. Default: false

disabled.name: disabled
disabled.help: Disables user input, making the control read-only. To disable input, specify disabled without an attribute or disabled="true". To enable input, omit the attribute or specify disabled="false".

src.name: src
src.help: Applies to Flash button, reset, submit, and image types, and the HTML image type. URL of an image to use on the button. Flash does not support GIF images.

onkeyup.name: onkeyup
onkeyup.help: JavaScript (HTML/XML) or ActionScript (Flash) to run when the user releases a keyboard key in the control.

onkeydown.name: onkeydown
onkeydown.help: JavaScript (HTML/XML) or ActionScript (Flash) ActionScript to run when the user presses a keyboard key in the control.

onmouseup.name: onmouseup
onmouseup.help: JavaScript (HTML/XML) or ActionScript (Flash) to run when the user presses a mouse button in the control.

onmousedown.name: onmousedown
onmousedown.help: JavaScript (HTML/XML) or ActionScript (Flash) to run when the user releases a mouse button in the control.

onchange.name: onchange
onchange.help: JavaScript (HTML/XML) or ActionScript (Flash) to run when the control changes due to user action. In Flash, applies to datefield, password, and text types only.

onclick.name: onclick
onclick.help: JavaScript (HTML/XML) or ActionScript (Flash) to run when the user clicks the control. In Flash, applies to button, checkbox, image, radio, reset, and submit types only.

daynames.name: daynames
daynames.help: A comma-delimited list that sets the names of the weekdays displayed in the calendar. Sunday is the first day and the rest of the weekday names follow in the normal order. Default is: S,M,T,W,Th,F,S

firstdayofweek.name: firstdayofweek
firstdayofweek.help: Integer in the range 0-6 specifying the first day of the week in the calendar, 0 indicates Sunday, 6 indicates Saturday. Default is: 0

monthnames.name: monthnames
monthnames.help: A comma-delimited list of the month names that are displayed at the top of the calendar.

enabled.name: enabled
enabled.help: Flash only: Boolean value specifying whether the control is enabled. A disabled control appears in light gray. The inverse of the disabled attribute. Flash only. Default: true

visible.name: visible
visible.help: Flash only: Boolean value specifying whether to show the control. Space that would be occupied by an invisible control is blank. Default: true

tooltip.name: tooltip
tooltip.help: Flash only: Text to display when the mouse pointer hovers over the control.

width.name: width
width.help: Applies to most Flash types, HTML image type on some browsers. The width of the control, in pixels. For Flash forms, ColdFusion ignores this attribute if you also specify a size attribute value.

height.name: height
height.help: Applies to most Flash types, HTML image type on some browsers. The height of the control, in pixels. The displayed height might be less than the specified size.

delimiter.name: delimiter
delimiter.help: The delimiter to use to separate entries in a static autosuggest list. This attribute is meaningful only if the autosuggest attribute is a string of delimited values.

maxresultsdisplayed.name: maxresultsdisplayed
maxresultsdisplayed.help: The maximum number suggestions to display in the autosuggest list. Valid only for cfinput type="text".

onbinderror.name: onbinderror
onbinderror.help: The name of a JavaScript function to execute if evaluating a bind expression, including an autosuggest bind expression, results in an error. The function must take two attributes: an HTTP status code and a message.

showautosuggestloadingicon.name: showautosuggestloadingicon
showautosuggestloadingicon.help: A Boolean value that specifies whether to display an animated icon when loading an autosuggest value for a text input.

sourcefortooltip.name: sourcefortooltip
sourcefortooltip.help: The URL of a page to display as a tool tip. The page can include HTML markup to control the format, and the tip can include images. If you specify this attribute, an animated icon appears with the text "Loading..." while the tip is being loaded.

typeahead.name: typeahead
typeahead.help: A Boolean value that specifies whether the autosuggest feature should automatically complete a user's entry with the first result in the suggestion list. Valid only for cfinput type="text".

matchContains.name: matchContains
matchContains.help: true, match returned "contains" the query string. Default is false so that only results that "start with" the query string are returned.

cfinsert (tablename).name: cfinsert
cfinsert (tablename).help: Inserts records in data sources from data in a CFML form or form Scope.

datasource.name: datasource
datasource.help: Data source; contains table.

tablename.name: tablename
tablename.help: Table in which to insert form fields.  ORACLE drivers: must be uppercase. Sybase driver: case-sensitive. Must be the same case used when table was created

tableowner.name: tableowner
tableowner.help: For data sources that support table ownership (such as SQL Server, Oracle, and Sybase SQL Anywhere), use this field to specify the owner of the table.

tablequalifier.name: tablequalifier
tablequalifier.help: For data sources that support table qualifiers, use this field to specify qualifier for table. The purpose of table qualifiers varies among drivers. For SQL Server and Oracle, qualifier refers to name of database that contains table. For Intersolv dBASE driver, qualifier refers to directory where DBF files are located.

username.name: username
username.help: Overrides username specified in ODBC setup.

password.name: password
password.help: Overrides password specified in ODBC setup.

formfields.name: formfields
formfields.help: Comma-delimited list of form fields to insert. If not specified, all fields in the form are included.  If a form field is not matched by a column name in the database, CFML throws an error.  The database table key field must be present in the form. It may be hidden.

fetchclientinfo.name: fetchclientinfo
fetchclientinfo.help: Flag to indicate if clientinfo properties should be added to the result variable

clientinfo.name: clientinfo
clientinfo.help: Contains clientinfo properties to be set on the database connection

cfinsert.name: cfinsert
cfinsert.help: Inserts records in data sources from data in a CFML form or form Scope.

datasource.name: datasource
datasource.help: Data source; contains table.

tablename.name: tablename
tablename.help: Table in which to insert form fields.  ORACLE drivers: must be uppercase. Sybase driver: case-sensitive. Must be the same case used when table was created

tableowner.name: tableowner
tableowner.help: For data sources that support table ownership (such as SQL Server, Oracle, and Sybase SQL Anywhere), use this field to specify the owner of the table.

tablequalifier.name: tablequalifier
tablequalifier.help: For data sources that support table qualifiers, use this field to specify qualifier for table. The purpose of table qualifiers varies among drivers. For SQL Server and Oracle, qualifier refers to name of database that contains table. For Intersolv dBASE driver, qualifier refers to directory where DBF files are located.

username.name: username
username.help: Overrides username specified in ODBC setup.

password.name: password
password.help: Overrides password specified in ODBC setup.

formfields.name: formfields
formfields.help: Comma-delimited list of form fields to insert. If not specified, all fields in the form are included.  If a form field is not matched by a column name in the database, CFML throws an error.  The database table key field must be present in the form. It may be hidden.

fetchclientinfo.name: fetchclientinfo
fetchclientinfo.help: Flag to indicate if clientinfo properties should be added to the result variable

clientinfo.name: clientinfo
clientinfo.help: Contains clientinfo properties to be set on the database connection

cfinvoke.name: cfinvoke
cfinvoke.help: Does either of the following:  * Invokes a component method from within a CFML page or component. * Invokes a web service. Different attribute combonations make some attributes required at sometimes and not at others.

component.name: component
component.help: String or component object; a reference to a component, or component to instantiate.

method.name: method
method.help: Name of a method. For a web service, the name of an operation.

returnvariable.name: returnvariable
returnvariable.help: Name of a variable for the invocation result.

argumentcollection.name: argumentcollection
argumentcollection.help: Name of a structure; associative array of arguments to pass to the method.

username.name: username
username.help: Overrides username specified in Administrator > Web Services

password.name: password
password.help: Overrides passowrd specified in Administrator > Web Services

webservice.name: webservice
webservice.help: The URL of the WSDL file for the web service.

timeout.name: timeout
timeout.help: The timeout for the web service request, in seconds

proxyserver.name: proxyserver
proxyserver.help: The proxy server required to access the webservice URL.

proxyport.name: proxyport
proxyport.help: The port to use on The proxy server.

proxyuser.name: proxyuser
proxyuser.help: The user ID to send to the proxy server.

proxypassword.name: proxypassword
proxypassword.help: The user's password on the proxy server.

serviceport.name: serviceport
serviceport.help: The port name for the web service. This value is case-sensitive and corresponds to the port element's name attribute under the service element. Specify this attribute if the web service contains multiple ports. Default: first port found in the WSDL.

refreshwsdl.name: refreshwsdl
refreshwsdl.help: *  yes: reload the WSDL file and regenerate the artifacts used to consume the web service * no

wsdl2javaargs.name: wsdl2javaargs
wsdl2javaargs.help: A string that contains a space-delimited list of arguments to pass to the WSDL2Java tool that generates Java stubs for the web services.

wsversion.name: wsversion
wsversion.help: Specifies the version of Axis to be used. If it is "1" then axis 1 will be used and if it is "2" then Axis 2 will be used

cfinvokeargument.name: cfinvokeargument
cfinvokeargument.help: Passes the name and value of a parameter to a component method or a web service. This tag is used within the cfinvoke tag.

value.name: value
value.help: Argument value

omit.name: omit
omit.help: Enables you to omit a parameter when invoking a web service. It is an error to specify omit="true" if the cfinvoke webservice attribute is not specified. - true: omit this parameter when invoking a web service. - false: do not omit this parameter when invoking a web service.

cflayout.name: cflayout
cflayout.help: Creates a region of its container (such as the browser window or a cflayoutarea tag) with a specific layout behavior: a bordered area, a horizontal or vertically arranged box, or a tabbed navigator.

type.name: type
type.help: The type of layout.

align.name: align
align.help: Specifies the default alignment of the content of child layout areas. Each cflayoutarea tag can specify an alignment attribute to override this value.

name.name: name
name.help: The name of the layout region.  Must be unique on a page.

padding.name: padding
padding.help: Applies only to hbox and vbox layouts. You can use any valid CSS length or percent format, such as 10, 10% 10px, or 10em, for this attribute. The padding is included in the child layout area and takes the style of the layout area.

style.name: style
style.help: A CSS style specification that defines layout styles.

tabheight.name: tabheight
tabheight.help: A CSS style specification that defines layout stApplies only to tab type layouts. Specifies the height of the content area of all child layout areas. You can override this setting by specifying a hight setting in a individual cflayoutarea tag style attributes.

tabposition.name: tabposition
tabposition.help: Applies only to tab type layouts. Specifies the location of the tabs relative to the tab region contents.

titlecollapse.name: titlecollapse
titlecollapse.help: Specify whether title bar should act as collapse/expand toggle or not; default=true.

activeontop.name: activeontop
activeontop.help: Specify whether active tab needs to be on top always; default=false.

fillheight.name: fillheight
fillheight.help: True to adjust the active item's height to fill the available space in the container; default=true.

fitToWindow.name: fitToWindow
fitToWindow.help: A Boolean value that specifies whether the border layout should occupy 100% of the width and height of the window

height._: Height of the layout in pixels.
height.name: height

width._: Width of the layout in pixels.
width.name: width

tabstrip.name: tabstrip
tabstrip.help: If true, a background tab strip is displayed

cflayoutarea.name: cflayoutarea
cflayoutarea.help: Defines a region within a cflayout tag body, such as an individual tab of a tabbed layout. This tag is not used in Flash forms.

position.name: position
position.help: The position...(docs don't explain this one).

align.name: align
align.help: Specifies how to align child controls within the layout area.

closable.name: closable
closable.help: A Boolean value specifying whether the area can close. Specifying this attribute adds an x icon on the tab or title bar that a user can click to close the area. You cannot use this attribute for border layout areas with a position attribute value of center.

collapsible.name: collapsible
collapsible.help: A Boolean value specifying whether the area can collapse. Specifying this attribute adds a >> or << icon on the title bar that a user can click to collapse the area. You cannot use this attribute for border layout areas with a position attribute value of center.

disabled.name: disabled
disabled.help: A Boolean value specifying whether the tab is disabled, that is, whether user can select the tab to display its contents. Disabled tabs are greyed out. Ignored if the selected attribute value is true.

initCollapsed.name: initCollapsed
initCollapsed.help: A Boolean value specifying whether the area is initially collapsed. You cannot use this attribute for border layout areas with a position attribute value of center. Ignored if the collapsible attribute value is false.

initHide.name: initHide
initHide.help: A Boolean value specifying whether the area is initially hidden. To show an initially hidden area, use the ColdFusion.Layout.showArea or ColdFusion.Layout.showTab function. You cannot use this attribute for border layout areas with a position attribute value of center.

maxSize.name: maxSize
maxSize.help: For layouts with top or bottom position attributes, the maximum height of the area, in pixels, that you can set by dragging a splitter. For layouts with left or right position attributes, the maximum width of the area. You cannot use this attribute for border layout areas with a position attribute value of center.

minSize.name: minSize
minSize.help: For layouts with top or bottom position attributes, the minimum height of the area, in pixels, that you can set by dragging a splitter. For layouts with left or right position attributes, the minimum width of the area., You cannot use this attribute for border layout areas with a position attribute value of center.

name.name: name
name.help: The name of the layout area.

onBindError.name: onBindError
onBindError.help: The name of a JavaScript function to execute if evaluating a bind expression results in an error. The function must take two attributes: an HTTP status code and a message. If you omit this attribute, and have specified a global error handler (by using the ColdFusion.setGlobalErrorHandlerfunction ), it displays the error message; otherwise a default error pop-up displays.

overflow.name: overflow
overflow.help: Specifies how to display child content whose size would cause the control to overflow the window boundaries.  ? In Internet Explorer, layout areas with the visible setting expand to fit the size of the contents, rather than having the contents extend beyond the layout area.

selected.name: selected
selected.help: A Boolean value specifying whether this tab is initially selected so that its contents appears in the layout.

size.name: size
size.help: For hbox layouts and border layouts with top or bottom position attributes, the initial height of the area. For vbox layouts and border layouts with left or right position attributes, the initial width of the area. For hbox and vbox layouts, you can use any valid CSS length or percent format (such as 10, 10% 10px, or 10em) for this attribute. For border layouts, this attribute value must be an integer number of pixels. You cannot use this attribute for border layout areas with a position attribute value of center. ColdFusion automatically determines the center size based on the size of all other layout areas.

source.name: source
source.help: A URL that returns the layout area contents. ColdFusion uses standard page path resolution rules. You can use a bind expression with dependencies in this attribute. If file specified in this attribute includes tags that use AJAX features, such as cfform, cfgrid, and cfpod, you must use the cfajaximport tag on the page that includes the cflayoutarea tag. For more information, see cfajaximport.

splitter.name: splitter
splitter.help: A Boolean value specifying whether the layout area has a divider between it and the adjacent layoutarea control. Users can drag the splitter to change the relative sizes of the areas. If this attribute is set true on a left or right position layout area, the splitter resizes the area and its adjacent area horizontally. If this attribute is set true on a top or bottom position layout area, the splitter resizes the layout vertically. You cannot use this attribute for border layout areas with a position attribute value of center

style.name: style
style.help: A CSS style specification that controls the appearance of the area.

title.name: title
title.help: For tab layouts, the text to display on the tab. For border layouts, if you specify this attribute ColdFusion creates a title bar for the layout area with the specified text as the title. By default, these layouts do not have a title bar if they are not closable or collapsible. You cannot use this attribute for border layout areas with a position attribute value of center.

refreshonactivate.name: refreshonactivate
refreshonactivate.help: *  true: Refresh the contents of the tab by running the source bind expression whenever the tab display region shows (for example, when the user selects the tab), in addition to when bind events occur. * false: Refresh the tab display region only when the bind expression is triggered by its bind event.

titleIcon.name: titleIcon
titleIcon.help: Specifies the location of the icon to display with the title.

bindOnLoad.name: bindOnLoad
bindOnLoad.help: A Boolean value that specifies whether to execute the bind attribute expression when first loading the form. Ignored if there is no bind attribute.

tabtip.name: tabtip
tabtip.help: If true, a tab tip is displayed

cfldap.name: cfldap
cfldap.help: Provides an interface to a Lightweight Directory Access Protocol (LDAP) directory server, such as the Netscape Directory Server.

server.name: server
server.help: Host name or IP address of LDAP server.

username.name: username
username.help: The User ID. Required if secure = "CFSSL_BASIC"

password.name: password
password.help: Password that corresponds to user name. If secure = "CFSSL_BASIC", V2 encrypts the password before transmission.

action.name: action
action.help: * query: returns LDAP entry information only. Requires name, start, and attributes attributes. * add: adds LDAP entries to LDAP server. Requires attributes attribute. * modify: modifies LDAP entries, except distinguished name dn attribute, on LDAP server. Requires dn. See modifyType attribute. * modifyDN: modifies distinguished name attribute for LDAP entries on LDAP server. Requires dn. * delete: deletes LDAP entries on an LDAP server. Requires dn.

name.name: name
name.help: Required if action = "Query" Name of LDAP query. The tag validates the value.

timeout.name: timeout
timeout.help: Maximum length of time, in seconds, to wait for LDAP processing. Default 60000

maxrows.name: maxrows
maxrows.help: Maximum number of entries for LDAP queries.

start.name: start
start.help: Required if action = "Query" Distinguished name of entry to be used to start a search.

scope.name: scope
scope.help: Scope of search, from entry specified in start attribute for action = "Query". * oneLevel: entries one level below entry. * base: only the entry. * subtree: entry and all levels below it.

attributes.name: attributes
attributes.help: Required if action = "Query", "Add", "ModifyDN", or "Modify" For queries: comma-delimited list of attributes to return. For queries, to get all attributes, specify "*".  If action = "add" or "modify", you can specify a list of update columns. Separate attributes with a semicolon.  If action = "ModifyDN", CFML passes attributes to the LDAP server without syntax checking.

returnasbinary.name: returnasbinary
returnasbinary.help: A comma-delimited list of columns that are to be returned as binary values.

filter.name: filter
filter.help: Search criteria for action = "Query". List attributes in the form: "(attribute operator value)" Example: "(sn = Smith)"

sort.name: sort
sort.help: Attribute(s) by which to sort query results. Use a comma delimiter.

sortcontrol.name: sortcontrol
sortcontrol.help: Default asc * nocase: case-insensitive sort * asc: ascending (a to z) case-sensitive sort * desc: descending (z to a) case-sensitive sort  You can enter a combination of sort types; for example, sortControl = "nocase, asc".

dn.name: dn
dn.help: Distinguished name, for update action. Example: "cn = Bob Jensen, o = Ace Industry, c = US"

startrow.name: startrow
startrow.help: Used with action = "query". First row of LDAP query to insert into a CFML query.

modifytype.name: modifytype
modifytype.help: Default replace  How to process an attribute in a multi-value list. * add: appends it to any attributes * delete: deletes it from the set of attributes * replace: replaces it with specified attributes  You cannot add an attribute that is already present or that is empty.

rebind.name: rebind
rebind.help: * Yes: attempt to rebind referral callback and reissue query by referred address using original credentials. * No: referred connections are anonymous

referral.name: referral
referral.help: Number of hops allowed in a referral. A value of 0 disables referred addresses for LDAP; no data is returned.

secure.name: secure
secure.help: Security to employ, and required information. One option: * CFSSL_BASIC  "CFSSL_BASIC" provides V2 SSL encryption and server authentication.

separator.name: separator
separator.help: Default , (a comma) Delimiter to separate attribute values of multi-value attributes. Used by query, add, and modify actions, and by cfldap to output multi-value attributes.  For example, if $ (dollar sign), the attributes attribute could be "objectclass = top$person", where the first value of objectclass is top, and the second value is person. This avoids confusion if values include commas.

delimiter.name: delimiter
delimiter.help: Separator between attribute name-value pairs. Use this attribute if:  * the attributes attribute specifies more than one item, or * an attribute contains the default delimiter (semicolon). For example: mgrpmsgrejecttext;lang-en  Used by query, add, and modify actions, and by cfldap to output multi-value attributes.  For example, if $ (dollar sign), you could specify "cn = Double Tree Inn$street = 1111 Elm; Suite 100 where the semicolon is part of the street value.

usetls.name: usetls
usetls.help: If STARTTLS command should be sent

cflocation (url).name: cflocation
cflocation (url).help: Stops execution of the current page and opens a CFML page or HTML file.

url.name: url
url.help: URL of HTML file or CFML page to open.

addtoken.name: addtoken
addtoken.help: If url parameters need to be added to url or not

cflocation.name: cflocation
cflocation.help: Stops execution of the current page and opens a CFML page or HTML file.

url.name: url
url.help: URL of HTML file or CFML page to open.

addtoken.name: addtoken
addtoken.help: If url parameters need to be added to url or not

cflock (timeout).name: cflock
cflock (timeout).help: Ensures the integrity of shared data. Instantiates the following kinds of locks:  * Exclusive allows single-thread access to the CFML constructs * Read-only allows multiple requests to access CFML constructs

timeout.name: timeout
timeout.help: Maximum length of time, in seconds, to wait to obtain a lock. If lock is obtained, tag execution continues. Otherwise, behavior depends on throwOnTimeout attribute value.

scope.name: scope
scope.help: Lock scope. Mutually exclusive with the name attribute. Lock name. Only one request in the specified scope can execute the code within this tag (or within any other cflock tag with the same lock scope scope) at a time.

name.name: name
name.help: Lock name. Mutually exclusive with the scope attribute. Only one request can execute the code within a cflock tag with a given name at a time. Cannot be an empty string.

type.name: type
type.help: readOnly: lets more than one request read shared data. exclusive: lets one request read or write shared data.

cflock.name: cflock
cflock.help: Ensures the integrity of shared data. Instantiates the following kinds of locks:  * Exclusive allows single-thread access to the CFML constructs * Read-only allows multiple requests to access CFML constructs

timeout.name: timeout
timeout.help: Maximum length of time, in seconds, to wait to obtain a lock. If lock is obtained, tag execution continues. Otherwise, behavior depends on throwOnTimeout attribute value.

scope.name: scope
scope.help: Lock scope. Mutually exclusive with the name attribute. Lock name. Only one request in the specified scope can execute the code within this tag (or within any other cflock tag with the same lock scope scope) at a time.

name.name: name
name.help: Lock name. Mutually exclusive with the scope attribute. Only one request can execute the code within a cflock tag with a given name at a time. Cannot be an empty string.

type.name: type
type.help: readOnly: lets more than one request read shared data. exclusive: lets one request read or write shared data.

cflog.name: cflog
cflog.help: Writes a message to a log file.

log.name: log
log.help: If you omit the file attribute, writes messages to standard log file. Ignored, if you specify file attribute.  Application: writes to Application.log, normally used for application-specific messages. Scheduler: writes to Scheduler.log, normally used to log the execution of scheduled tasks.

file.name: file
file.help: Message file. Specify only the main part of the filename. For example, to log to the Testing.log file, specify "Testing".  The file must be located in the default log directory. You cannot specify a directory path. If the file does not exist, it is created automatically, with the suffix .log.

type.name: type
type.help: Type (severity) of the message

application.name: application
application.help: Log application name, if it is specified in a cfapplication tag.

cflogin.name: cflogin
cflogin.help: A container for user login and authentication code. CFML runs the code in this tag if a user is not already logged in. You put code in the tag that authenticates the user and identifies the user with a set of roles. Used with cfloginuser tag.

idletimeout.name: idletimeout
idletimeout.help: Time interval with no keyboard activity after which CFML logs the user off. Seconds.

applicationtoken.name: applicationtoken
applicationtoken.help: Unique application identifier. Limits the login validity to one application, as specified by the cfapplication tag.

cookiedomain.name: cookiedomain
cookiedomain.help: Domain of the cookie that is used to mark a user as logged in. Use this attribute to enable a user login cookie to work with multiple clustered servers in the same domain.

allowconcurrent.name: allowconcurrent
allowconcurrent.help: If concurrent login sessions should be allowed.

usebasicauth.name: usebasicauth
usebasicauth.help: If basic authentication should be used to validate login.

cfloginuser.name: cfloginuser
cfloginuser.help: Identifies an authenticated user to CFML. Specifies the user ID and roles. Used within a cflogin tag.

password.name: password
password.help: A user password.

roles.name: roles
roles.help: A comma-delimited list of role identifiers.  CFML processes spaces in a list element as part of the element.

cflogout.name: cflogout
cflogout.help: Logs the current user out. Removes knowledge of the user ID, password, and roles from the server. If you do not use this tag, the user is automatically logged out when the session ends.

session.name: session
session.help: When invoked who all should be logged out.

cfloop (index).name: cfloop
cfloop (index).help: Different items are required based on loop type. Items listed as required may not be depending on your loop type. Loop forms: [query] [condition] [index + from + to ] [index + list] [collection + item ]

index.name: index
index.help: Index value. CFML sets it to from value and increments or decrements by step value, until it equals to value.

query.name: query
query.help: Query that controls the loop.

startrow.name: startrow
startrow.help: First row of query that is included in the loop.

endrow.name: endrow
endrow.help: Last row of query that is included in the loop.

list.name: list
list.help: A list, variable, or filename; contains a list

delimiters.name: delimiters
delimiters.help: Character(s) that separates items in list

collection.name: collection
collection.help: The collection attribute is used with the item attribute. often to loop over a structure

item.name: item
item.help: The item attribute is used with the collection attribute. often to loop over a structure

characters.name: characters
characters.help: The number of characters to read during each iteration of the loop from the file specified in the file attribute. If the value of the characters attribute is more than the number of characters in the file, ColdFusion uses the number of characters in the file.

file.name: file
file.help: The absolute path and filename of the text file to read, one line at a time. This is helpful when reading large text files, because you can reuse the value of the index variable, which contains the current line of the file. When the loop completes, ColdFusion closes the file.

group.name: group
group.help: Query column to use to group sets of records. Eliminates adjacent duplicate rows when data is sorted. Use if you retrieved a record set ordered on one or more a query columns. For example, if a record set is ordered on "Customer_ID" in the cfquery tag, you can group the output on "Customer_ID."

groupcasesensitive.name: groupcasesensitive
groupcasesensitive.help: Whether to consider the case in grouping rows.

cfloop (condition).name: cfloop
cfloop (condition).help: Different items are required based on loop type. Items listed as required may not be depending on your loop type. Loop forms: [query] [condition] [index + from + to ] [index + list] [collection + item ]

startrow.help: First row of query that is included in the loop.

endrow.name: endrow
endrow.help: Last row of query that is included in the loop.

list.help: A list, variable, or filename; contains a list

delimiters.help: Character(s) that separates items in list

cfmail (from).name: cfmail
cfmail (from).help: Sends an e-mail message that optionally contains query output, using an SMTP server.

cc.name: cc
cc.help: Address(es) to which to copy the message

bcc.name: bcc
bcc.help: Address(es) to which to copy the message, without listing them in the message header.

subject.name: subject
subject.help: Message subject. Can be dynamically generated.

replyto.name: replyto
replyto.help: Address(es) to which the recipient is directed to send replies.

failto.name: failto
failto.help: Address to which mailing systems should send delivery failure notifications. Sets the mail envelope reverse-path value.

username.name: username
username.help: A user name to send to SMTP servers that require authentication. Requires a password attribute

password.name: password
password.help: A password to send to SMTP servers that require authentication. Requires a username attribute.

wraptext.name: wraptext
wraptext.help: Specifies the maximum line length, in characters of the mail text. If a line has more than the specified number of characters, replaces the last white space character, such as a tab or space, preceding the specified position with a line break. If there are no white space characters, inserts a line break at the specified position. A common value for this attribute is 72.

charset.name: charset
charset.help: The character encoding in which the part text is encoded.  For more information on character encodings, see: www.w3.org/International/O-charset.html.

type.name: type
type.help: The MIME media type of the part. Can be a can be valid MIME media type

mimeattach.name: mimeattach
mimeattach.help: Path of file to attach to message. Attached file is MIME-encoded. CFML attempts to determine the MIME type of the file; use the cfmailparam tag to send an attachement and specify the MIME type.

query.name: query
query.help: Name of cfquery from which to draw data for message(s). Use this attribute to send more than one message, or to send query results within a message.

group.name: group
group.help: Query column to use when you group sets of records to send as a message. For example, to send a set of billing statements to a customer, group on "Customer_ID." Case-sensitive. Eliminates adjacent duplicates when data is sorted by the specified field.

groupcasesensitive.name: groupcasesensitive
groupcasesensitive.help: Whether to consider case when using the group attribute. To group on case-sensitive records, set this attribute to Yes.

startrow.name: startrow
startrow.help: Row in a query to start from.

maxrows.name: maxrows
maxrows.help: Maximum number of messages to send when looping over a query.

server.name: server
server.help: SMTP server address, or (Enterprise edition only) a comma-delimited list of server addresses, to use for sending messages. At least one server must be specified here or in the CFML MX Administrator. A value here overrides the Administrator. A value that includes a port specification overrides the port attribute. See the Usage section for details.

port.name: port
port.help: TCP/IP port on which SMTP server listens for requests (normally 25). A value here overrides the Administrator.

mailerid.name: mailerid
mailerid.help: Mailer ID to be passed in X-Mailer SMTP header, which identifies the mailer application.

timeout.name: timeout
timeout.help: Number of seconds to wait before timing out connection to SMTP server. A value here overrides the Administrator.

spoolenable.name: spoolenable
spoolenable.help: Specifies whether to spool mail or always send it Immediately. Overrides the CFML MX Administrator Spool mail messages to disk for delivery setting.

debug.name: debug
debug.help: * Yes: sends debugging output to standard output. By default, if the console window is unavailable, ColdFusion sends output to cf_root\runtime\logs\coldfusion-out.log on server configurations. On J2EE configurations, with JRun, the default location is jrun_home/logs/servername-out.log. * No: does not generate debugging output.

priority.name: priority
priority.help: The message priority level. Can be one of the following values: * An integer in the range 1-5; 1 represents the highest priority. * One of the following string values, which correspond to the numeric values: highest or urgent, high, normal, low, and lowest or non-urgent.

usessl.name: usessl
usessl.help: Whether to use Secure Sockets Layer.

usetls.name: usetls
usetls.help: Whether to use Transport Level Security.

remove.name: remove
remove.help: Tells ColdFusion to remove any attachments after successful mail delivery.

keystore.name: keystore
keystore.help: Keystore containing the private key and certificate. The supported type is JKS (java key store) and pkcs12

keypassword.name: keypassword
keypassword.help: Password with which the private key is stored. If it is not specified, keystorepassword will be used as keypassword as well.

sign.name: sign
sign.help: Mail will be signed when set to true

keyalias.name: keyalias
keyalias.help: Alias of the key with which the certificate and private key is stored in keystore. If it is not specified then the first entry in the keystore will be picked up.

encrypt.name: encrypt
encrypt.help: If email should be encrypted or not.

recipientCert.name: recipientCert
recipientCert.help: Path to public key certificate of recipient.

cfmail (subject).name: cfmail
cfmail (subject).help: Sends an e-mail message that optionally contains query output, using an SMTP server.

cc.help: Address(es) to which to copy the message
