accesstokenendpoint.help: If type is not specified this will be used as end point url to be invoked for app authentication

state.name: state
state.help: Indicates any state which may be useful to your application upon receipt of response

authendpoint.name: authendpoint
authendpoint.help: If type is not specified this will be used as end point url to be invoked for user authentication

type.name: type
type.help: OAUTH2 server. Right now only google and facebook are supported

secretkey.name: secretkey
secretkey.help: App secret key as shown in your application's settings

cfclient.name: cfclient
cfclient.help: Marker tag for client side code generation in JavaScript

cfclientsettings.name: cfclientsettings
cfclientsettings.help: Settings for loading the required plugins

enableDeviceAPI.name: enableDeviceAPI
enableDeviceAPI.help: Whether to load PhoneGap plugin or not

detectDevice.name: detectDevice
detectDevice.help: Whether to load the device detection plugin or not

deviceTimeOut.name: deviceTimeOut
deviceTimeOut.help: Number of seconds to time out while checking whether the required plugins are loaded sucessfully. It is used when enableDeviceApi or detectDevice is enabled. Default value is 10 seconds.

cfhtmltopdf.name: cfhtmltopdf
cfhtmltopdf.help: Converts html to high quality pdf

source.name: source
source.help: URL|pathname relative to web root, absolute pathname to a file

saveasname.name: saveasname
saveasname.help: pdf file name to show in save as dialogue in browser

overwrite.name: overwrite
overwrite.help: If destination file already found, overwrite should be done or not

unit.name: unit
unit.help: Unit in which numbers to specify

permissions.name: permissions
permissions.help: List of permission to apply on generated pdf

userpassword.name: userpassword
userpassword.help: Password to open document as user

ownerpassword.name: ownerpassword
ownerpassword.help: Password to open document as owner

cfhtmltopdfitem.name: cfhtmltopdfitem
cfhtmltopdfitem.help: Child tag to add header or footer in cfhtmltopdf tag

type.name: type
type.help: What type of item should be added

isbase64.name: isbase64
isbase64.help: Used only when image attribute is given a base64 image string

showonprint.name: showonprint
showonprint.help: If header/footer should be shown on print

marginleft.name: marginleft
marginleft.help: Value of the header / footer left margin

marginright.name: marginright
marginright.help: Value of the header / footer right margin

margintop.name: margintop
margintop.help: Value of the top margin of the header

marginbottom.name: marginbottom
marginbottom.help: Value of the bottommargin of the footer

numberformat.name: numberformat
numberformat.help: Number formatting to use with page numbers. Used with either _PAGENUMBER or _LASTPAGENUMBER

image.name: image
image.help: Image file name or object to be used as the header or footer

abs.name: abs
abs.help: Absolute-value function. The absolute value of a number is the number without its sign.

aCos.name: aCos
aCos.help: Returns the angle whose cosine is the value passed as the argument.

number.name: number
number.help: The value to be converted into an angle. Must be between -1 and 1.

ajaxLink.name: ajaxLink
ajaxLink.help: Causes an HTML href attribute to display link results in the current Ajax container.

ajaxOnLoad.name: ajaxOnLoad
ajaxOnLoad.help: Causes the specified JavaScript function to run when the page loads.

functionname.name: functionname
functionname.help: The name of the function to run when the page loads.

arrayContains.name: arrayContains
arrayContains.help: Returns true if specified object is present is given array

arrayDelete.name: arrayDelete
arrayDelete.help: Deletes specified object from given array

arrayMax.name: arrayMax
arrayMax.help: Returns the largest numeric value in an array. If the array parameter value is an empty array, returns zero. All elements must contain values that can be automatically converted to numeric values.

arrayMin.name: arrayMin
arrayMin.help: Returns the smallest numeric value in an array. If the array parameter value is an empty array, returns zero. All elements must contain values that can be automatically converted to numeric values.

arrayLen.name: arrayLen
arrayLen.help: Determines the number of elements in an array. CFML MX: this function can be used on child XML objects.

arrayAppend.name: arrayAppend
arrayAppend.help: Appends an array element to an array.

array.name: array
array.help: The array to which the element should be appended.

value.name: value
value.help: The element to append. Can be any type.

arrayconcat.name: arrayconcat
arrayconcat.help: If true adds array as one element, else adds individual elements. Default is false

arrayAvg.name: arrayAvg
arrayAvg.help: Calculates the average of the values in an array. All elements in the array must contain values that can be automatically converted to numeric.

arrayClear.name: arrayClear
arrayClear.help: Removes all elements from an array.

arrayNew.name: arrayNew
arrayNew.help: Creates an array of 1-3 dimensions. Index array elements with square brackets: [ ]. CFML arrays expand dynamically as data is added.

arrayPrepend.name: arrayPrepend
arrayPrepend.help: Inserts an array element at the beginning of an array and shifts the positions of the existing elements to make room.

arrayResize.name: arrayResize
arrayResize.help: Resets an array to a specified minimum number of elements. This can improve performance, if used to size an array to its expected maximum. For more than 500 elements, use ArrayResize immediately after using the ArrayNew tag.

arraySet.name: arraySet
arraySet.help: In a one-dimensional array, sets the elements in a specified index range to a value. Useful for initializing an array after a call to ArrayNew.

arraySort.name: arraySort
arraySort.help: Sorting function where comparing algorithm is customized and passed as closure. The two objects that need to be compared are passed as two arguments to the closure function. The closure function should return 1,0 or -1 to signify that first object is larger, equals and shorter than second obj.

localeSensitive.name: localeSensitive
localeSensitive.help: Performs locale sensitive sorting, if true. Default is false

arraySum.name: arraySum
arraySum.help: The sum of values in an array. If the array parameter value is an empty array, returns zero.

arraySwap.name: arraySwap
arraySwap.help: Swaps array values of an array at specified positions. This function is more efficient than multiple cfset tags

arrayToList.name: arrayToList
arrayToList.help: Converts a one-dimensional array to a list.

asc.name: asc
asc.help: Determines the value of a character.

aSin.name: aSin
aSin.help: Determines the arcsine of a number. The arcsine is the angle whose sine is number.

atn.name: atn
atn.help: Arctangent function. The arctangent is the angle whose tangent is number.

binaryDecode.name: binaryDecode
binaryDecode.help: Converts a string to a binary object. Used to convert binary data that has been encoded into string format back into binary data.

String.name: String
String.help: A string containing encoded binary data.

binaryencoding.name: binaryencoding
binaryencoding.help: A string specifying the algorithm used to encode the original binary data into a string; must be one of the following: - hex: characters 0-9 and A-F represent the hexadecimal value of each byte; for example, 3A. - UU: data is encoded using the UNIX UUencode algorithm. - base64: data is encoded using the Base64 algorithm.

binaryEncode.name: binaryEncode
binaryEncode.help: Converts binary data to a string.

binarydata.name: binarydata
binarydata.help: A string containing encoded binary data.

encoding.name: encoding
encoding.help: A string specifying the encoding method to use to represent the data; one of the following: - hex: use characters 0-9 and A-F represent the hexadecimal value of each byte; for example, 3A. - UU: use the UNIX UUencode algorithm to convert the data. - base64: use the Base64 algorithm to convert the data.

bitAnd.name: bitAnd
bitAnd.help: Performs a bitwise logical AND operation.

bitMaskClear.name: bitMaskClear
bitMaskClear.help: Performs a bitwise mask clear operation.

bitMaskRead.name: bitMaskRead
bitMaskRead.help: Performs a bitwise mask read operation. Returns an integer, created from length bits of number, beginning at start.

bitMaskSet.name: bitMaskSet
bitMaskSet.help: Performs a bitwise mask set operation.

bitNOT.name: bitNOT
bitNOT.help: Performs a bitwise logical NOT operation.

bitOR.name: bitOR
bitOR.help: Performs a bitwise logical OR operation.

bitShln.name: bitShln
bitShln.help: Performs a bitwise shift-left, no-rotation operation.

bitShrn.name: bitShrn
bitShrn.help: Performs a bitwise shift-right, no-rotation operation.

bitXOR.name: bitXOR
bitXOR.help: Performs a bitwise logical XOR operation.

ceiling.name: ceiling
ceiling.help: Determines the closest integer that is greater than a specified number.

charsetDecode.name: charsetDecode
charsetDecode.help: Converts as string to a binary representation.

String.name: String
String.help: A string containing data to encode in binary format.

encoding.name: encoding
encoding.help: A string specifying encoding of the input data.

charsetEncode.name: charsetEncode
charsetEncode.help: Uses the specified encoding to convert binary data to a string.

binaryobject.name: binaryobject
binaryobject.help: A variable containing binary data to decode into text.

encoding.name: encoding
encoding.help: The character encoding that was used to encode the string into binary format.

chr.name: chr
chr.help: Converts a numeric value to a UCS-2 character.

cJustify.name: cJustify
cJustify.help: Centers a string in a field length.

compare.name: compare
compare.help: Performs a case-sensitive comparison of two strings. -1, if string1 is less than string2 0, if string1 is equal to string2 1, if string1 is greater than string2

compareNoCase.name: compareNoCase
compareNoCase.help: Performs a case-insensitive comparison of two strings. An indicator of the difference: A negative number, if string1 is less than string2 0, if string1 is equal to string2 A positive number, if string1 is greater than string2

cos.name: cos
cos.help: Calculates the cosine of an angle that is entered in radians. A number; the cosine of the angle.

createObject.name: createObject
createObject.help: The CreateObject function takes different arguments depending on the value of the first argument:  CreateObject('com', class, context, serverName) CreateObject('component', component-name) CreateObject('corba', context, class, locale) CreateObject('java', class) CreateObject('webservice', urltowsdl, [, portname])

urltowsdl.name: urltowsdl
urltowsdl.help: WSDL file URL; location of web service

portname.name: portname
portname.help: The port name for the web service. This value is case-sensitive and corresponds to the port element's name attribute under the service element. Specify this parameter if the web service contains multiple ports. If no port name is specified, ColdFusion uses the first port found in the WSDL.

createTimespan.name: createTimespan
createTimespan.help: Creates a date/time object that defines a time period. You can add or subtract it from other date/time objects and use it with the cachedWithin attribute of cfquery.

createUUID.name: createUUID
createUUID.help: Creates a Universally Unique Identifier (UUID). A UUID is a 35-character string representation of a unique 128-bit integer xxxxxxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx : x is a hexadecimal digit

dateAdd.name: dateAdd
dateAdd.help: Adds units of time to a date. [datepart - quicky] yyyy: Year; q: Quarter; m: Month; y: Day of year; d: Day w: Weekday; ww: Week; h: Hour; n: Minute; s: Second; l: Millisecond

dateCompare.name: dateCompare
dateCompare.help: Performs a full date/time comparison of two dates. -1, if date1 is less than date2 0, if date1 is equal to date2 1, if date1 is greater than date2 [datepart - quicky] yyyy: Year; q: Quarter; m: Month; y: Day of year; d: Day w: Weekday; ww: Week; h: Hour; n: Minute; s: Second; l: Millisecond

dateConvert.name: dateConvert
dateConvert.help: Converts local time to Coordinated Universal Time (UTC), or UTC to local time. The function uses the daylight savings settings in the executing computer to compute daylight savings time, if required. [type - quicky] local2Utc: Converts local time to UTC time. utc2Local: Converts UTC time to local time

dateDiff.name: dateDiff
dateDiff.help: Determines the integer number of units by which date1 is less than date2. [datepart - quicky] yyyy: Year; q: Quarter; m: Month; y: Day of year; d: Day w: Weekday; ww: Week; h: Hour; n: Minute; s: Second; l: Millisecond

dateFormat.name: dateFormat
dateFormat.help: Formats a date value using U.S. date formats. For international date support, use LSDateFormat. [mask - quicky] d,dd,ddd,dddd: Day of month / week m,mm,mmm,mmmm: Month; y,yy,yyyy: Year; gg: Period/era string short / medium / long / full

datePart.name: datePart
datePart.help: Extracts a part from a date value as a numeric. [datepart - quicky] yyyy: Year; q: Quarter; m: Month; y: Day of year; d: Day w: Weekday; ww: Week; h: Hour; n: Minute; s: Second; l: Millisecond

day.name: day
day.help: Determines the day of the month, in a date. The ordinal for the day of the month, ranging from 1 to 31.

dayOfWeek.name: dayOfWeek
dayOfWeek.help: Determines the day of the week, in a date.

dayOfWeekAsString.name: dayOfWeekAsString
dayOfWeekAsString.help: Determines the day of the week as a string from 1-7

dayOfYear.name: dayOfYear
dayOfYear.help: Determines the day of the year, in a date.

daysInMonth.name: daysInMonth
daysInMonth.help: Determines the number of days in a month.

daysInYear.name: daysInYear
daysInYear.help: Determines the number of days in a year.

de.name: de
de.help: Postpones evaluation of a string as an expression, when it is passed as a parameter to the IIf or Evaluate functions. Escapes any double quotation marks in the parameter and wraps the result in double quotation marks.

decimalFormat.name: decimalFormat
decimalFormat.help: Converts a number to a decimal-formatted string.

decrementValue.name: decrementValue
decrementValue.help: Decrements the integer part of a number.

decrypt.name: decrypt
decrypt.help: Decrypts a string that is encrypted with the Encrypt function.

key.name: key
key.help: Key or seed used to encrypt the string. * For the CFMX_COMPAT algorithm, any combination of any number of characters; used as a seed used to generate a 32-bit encryption key. * For all other algorithms, a key in the format used by the algorithm. For these algorithms, use the GenerateSecretKey function to generate the key.

algorithm.name: algorithm
algorithm.help: The algorithm to use to decrypt the string. Must be the same as the algorithm used to encrypt the string. * CFMX_COMPAT: the algorithm used in ColdFusion MX and prior releases. This algorithm is the least secure option (default). * AES: the Advanced Encryption Standard specified by the National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST) FIPS-197. * BLOWFISH: the Blowfish algorithm defined by Bruce Schneier. * DES: the Data Encryption Standard algorithm defined by NIST FIPS-46-3. * DESEDE: the "Triple DES" algorithm defined by NIST FIPS-46-3.

encoding.name: encoding
encoding.help: The binary encoding used to represent the data as a string. Must be the same as the algorithm used to encrypt the string. * Base64: the Base64 algorithm, as specified by IETF RFC 2045. * Hex: the characters A-F and 0-9 represent the hexadecimal byte values. * UU: the UNIX standard UUEncode algorithm (default). If you specify this parameter, you must also specify the algorithm parameter.

ivorsalt.name: ivorsalt
ivorsalt.help: Specify this parameter to adjust ColdFusion encryption to match the details of other encryption software. If you specify this parameter, you must also specify the algorithm parameter. * For Block Encryption Algorithms: This is the binary Initialization Vector value to use with the algorithm. The algorithm must contain a Feedback Mode other than ECB. This must be a binary value that is exactly the same size as the algorithm block size. * For Password Based Encryption Algorithms: This is the binary Salt value to transform the password into a key.

iterations.name: iterations
iterations.help: The number of iterations to transform the password into a binary key. Specify this parameter to adjust ColdFusion encryption to match the details of other encryption software. If you specify this parameter, you must also specify the algorithm parameter with a Password Based Encryption (PBE) algorithm. Do not specify this parameter for Block Encryption Algorithms. You must use the same value to encrypt and decrypt the data. * For Password Based Encryption Algorithms: This is the binary Salt value to transform the password into a key.

decryptBinary.name: decryptBinary
decryptBinary.help: Decrypts encrypted binary data with the specified key, value, algorithm, salt, and iterations.

key.name: key
key.help: Key or seed used to encrypt the string. * For the CFMX_COMPAT algorithm, any combination of any number of characters; used as a seed used to generate a 32-bit encryption key. * For all other algorithms, a key in the format used by the algorithm. For these algorithms, use the GenerateSecretKey function to generate the key.

algorithm.name: algorithm
algorithm.help: The algorithm to use to decrypt the string. Must be the same as the algorithm used to encrypt the string. * CFMX_COMPAT: the algorithm used in ColdFusion MX and prior releases. This algorithm is the least secure option (default). * AES: the Advanced Encryption Standard specified by the National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST) FIPS-197. * BLOWFISH: the Blowfish algorithm defined by Bruce Schneier. * DES: the Data Encryption Standard algorithm defined by NIST FIPS-46-3. * DESEDE: the "Triple DES" algorithm defined by NIST FIPS-46-3.

ivorsalt.name: ivorsalt
ivorsalt.help: Specify this parameter to adjust ColdFusion encryption to match the details of other encryption software. If you specify this parameter, you must also specify the algorithm parameter. * For Block Encryption Algorithms: This is the binary Initialization Vector value to use with the algorithm. The algorithm must contain a Feedback Mode other than ECB. This must be a binary value that is exactly the same size as the algorithm block size. * For Password Based Encryption Algorithms: This is the binary Salt value to transform the password into a key.

iterations.name: iterations
iterations.help: The number of iterations to transform the password into a binary key. Specify this parameter to adjust ColdFusion encryption to match the details of other encryption software. If you specify this parameter, you must also specify the algorithm parameter with a Password Based Encryption (PBE) algorithm. Do not specify this parameter for Block Encryption Algorithms. You must use the same value to encrypt and decrypt the data. * For Password Based Encryption Algorithms: This is the binary Salt value to transform the password into a key.

deleteClientVariable.name: deleteClientVariable
deleteClientVariable.help: Deletes a client variable. (To test for the existence of a variable, use IsDefined.)

deserializeJSON.name: deserializeJSON
deserializeJSON.help: Converts a JSON (JavaScript Object Notation) string data representation into CFML data, such as a CFML structure or array.

stringToBeDeserialized.name: stringToBeDeserialized
stringToBeDeserialized.help: A string that contains a valid JSON construct, or variable that represents one.

strictmapping.name: strictmapping
strictmapping.help: A Boolean value that specifies whether to convert the JSON strictly.

usecustomserializer.name: usecustomserializer
usecustomserializer.help: Whether to use the customSerializer or not. The default value is true. Always the custom serializer will be used for deserialization. If specified false, the JSON deserialization will be done using the default ColdFusion behaviour.

directoryCreate.name: directoryCreate
directoryCreate.help: Creates new directory for specified path

directoryList.name: directoryList
directoryList.help: Lists the directory and returns the list of files under it as array or query

dollarFormat.name: dollarFormat
dollarFormat.help: Formats a string in U.S. format. (For other currencies, use LSCurrencyFormat or LSEuroCurrencyFormat.)

dotnetToCFType.name: dotnetToCFType
dotnetToCFType.help: Explicitly converts a value returned by a .NET method to the corresponding ColdFusion data type.

duplicate.name: duplicate
duplicate.help: Returns a clone, also known as a deep copy, of a variable or XML object. There is no reference to the original variable.

encrypt.name: encrypt
encrypt.help: Encrypts a string. Uses a symmetric key-based algorithm, in which the same key is used to encrypt and decrypt a string. The security of the encrypted string depends on maintaining the secrecy of the key. Uses an XOR-based algorithm that uses a pseudo-random 32-bit key, based on a seed passed by the user as a function parameter.

key.name: key
key.help: Key or seed used to encrypt the string. * For the CFMX_COMPAT algorithm, any combination of any number of characters; used as a seed used to generate a 32-bit encryption key. * For all other algorithms, a key in the format used by the algorithm. For these algorithms, use the GenerateSecretKey function to generate the key.

algorithm.name: algorithm
algorithm.help: The algorithm to use to encrypt the string. * CFMX_COMPAT: the algorithm used in ColdFusion MX and prior releases. This algorithm is the least secure option (default). * AES: the Advanced Encryption Standard specified by the National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST) FIPS-197. * BLOWFISH: the Blowfish algorithm defined by Bruce Schneier. * DES: the Data Encryption Standard algorithm defined by NIST FIPS-46-3. * DESEDE: the "Triple DES" algorithm defined by NIST FIPS-46-3.

encoding.name: encoding
encoding.help: The binary encoding used to represent the data as a string. Must be the same as the algorithm used to encrypt the string. * Base64: the Base64 algorithm, as specified by IETF RFC 2045. * Hex: the characters A-F and 0-9 represent the hexadecimal byte values. * UU: the UNIX standard UUEncode algorithm (default). If you specify this parameter, you must also specify the algorithm parameter.

ivorsalt.name: ivorsalt
ivorsalt.help: Specify this parameter to adjust ColdFusion encryption to match the details of other encryption software. If you specify this parameter, you must also specify the algorithm parameter. * For Block Encryption Algorithms: This is the binary Initialization Vector value to use with the algorithm. The algorithm must contain a Feedback Mode other than ECB. This must be a binary value that is exactly the same size as the algorithm block size. * For Password Based Encryption Algorithms: This is the binary Salt value to transform the password into a key.

iterations.name: iterations
iterations.help: The number of iterations to transform the password into a binary key. Specify this parameter to adjust ColdFusion encryption to match the details of other encryption software. If you specify this parameter, you must also specify the algorithm parameter with a Password Based Encryption (PBE) algorithm. Do not specify this parameter for Block Encryption Algorithms. You must use the same value to encrypt and decrypt the data. * For Password Based Encryption Algorithms: This is the binary Salt value to transform the password into a key.

encryptBinary.name: encryptBinary
encryptBinary.help: Encrypts binary data using a specific algorithm and encoding method.

key.name: key
key.help: Key or seed used to encrypt the string. * For the CFMX_COMPAT algorithm, any combination of any number of characters; used as a seed used to generate a 32-bit encryption key. * For all other algorithms, a key in the format used by the algorithm. For these algorithms, use the GenerateSecretKey function to generate the key.

algorithm.name: algorithm
algorithm.help: The algorithm to use to encrypt the string. * CFMX_COMPAT: the algorithm used in ColdFusion MX and prior releases. This algorithm is the least secure option (default). * AES: the Advanced Encryption Standard specified by the National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST) FIPS-197. * BLOWFISH: the Blowfish algorithm defined by Bruce Schneier. * DES: the Data Encryption Standard algorithm defined by NIST FIPS-46-3. * DESEDE: the "Triple DES" algorithm defined by NIST FIPS-46-3.

ivorsalt.name: ivorsalt
ivorsalt.help: Specify this parameter to adjust ColdFusion encryption to match the details of other encryption software. If you specify this parameter, you must also specify the algorithm parameter. * For Block Encryption Algorithms: This is the binary Initialization Vector value to use with the algorithm. The algorithm must contain a Feedback Mode other than ECB. This must be a binary value that is exactly the same size as the algorithm block size. * For Password Based Encryption Algorithms: This is the binary Salt value to transform the password into a key.

iterations.name: iterations
iterations.help: The number of iterations to transform the password into a binary key. Specify this parameter to adjust ColdFusion encryption to match the details of other encryption software. If you specify this parameter, you must also specify the algorithm parameter with a Password Based Encryption (PBE) algorithm. Do not specify this parameter for Block Encryption Algorithms. You must use the same value to encrypt and decrypt the data. * For Password Based Encryption Algorithms: This is the binary Salt value to transform the password into a key.

evaluate.name: evaluate
evaluate.help: Evaluates one or more string expressions, dynamically, from left to right. (The results of an evaluation on the left can have meaning in an expression to the right.) Returns the result of evaluating the rightmost expression.

exp.name: exp
exp.help: Calculates the exponent whose base is e that represents number. The constant e equals 2.71828182845904, the base of the natural logarithm. This function is the inverse of Log, the natural logarithm of number.

expandPath.name: expandPath
expandPath.help: Creates an absolute, platform-appropriate path that is equivalent to the value of relative_path, appended to the base path. This function (despite its name) can accept an absolute or relative path in the relative_path attribute

fileIsEOF.name: fileIsEOF
fileIsEOF.help: Determines whether ColdFusion has reached the end of the file while reading it.

find.name: find
find.help: Finds the first occurrence of a substring in a string, from a specified start position. The search is case-sensitive.

findNoCase.name: findNoCase
findNoCase.help: Finds the first occurrence of a substring in a string, from a specified start position. If substring is not in string, returns zero. The search is case-insensitive.

findOneOf.name: findOneOf
findOneOf.help: Finds the first occurrence of any one of a set of characters in a string, from a specified start position. The search is case-sensitive.

firstDayOfMonth.name: firstDayOfMonth
firstDayOfMonth.help: Determines the ordinal (day number, in the year) of the first day of the month in which a given date falls.

fix.name: fix
fix.help: Converts a real number to an integer.

formatBaseN.name: formatBaseN
formatBaseN.help: String Converts number to a string, in the base specified by radix. For example: #FormatBaseN(1024,16)#

generateSecretKey.name: generateSecretKey
generateSecretKey.help: Gets a secure key value for use in the encrypt function.

getAuthUser.name: getAuthUser
getAuthUser.help: Gets the name of an authenticated user.

getBaseTagData.name: getBaseTagData
getBaseTagData.help: Used within a custom tag. Finds calling (ancestor) tag by name and accesses its data.

getBaseTagList.name: getBaseTagList
getBaseTagList.help: Gets ancestor tag names, starting with the parent tag.

getBaseTemplatePath.name: getBaseTemplatePath
getBaseTemplatePath.help: Gets the absolute path of an application's base page.

getClientVariablesList.name: getClientVariablesList
getClientVariablesList.help: Finds the client variables to which a page has write access. Comma-delimited list of non-read-only client variables

getComponentMetadata.name: getComponentMetadata
getComponentMetadata.help: Gets metadata (such as the functions and implemented interfaces of a component) for a CFC or ColdFusion interface.

path.name: path
path.help: The dot-delimited path of the interface or CFC definition.

getContextRoot.name: getContextRoot
getContextRoot.help: Returns path to the J2EE server context root for the current request.

getCurrentTemplatePath.name: getCurrentTemplatePath
getCurrentTemplatePath.help: Gets the absolute path of the page that calls this function.

getDirectoryFromPath.name: getDirectoryFromPath
getDirectoryFromPath.help: Extracts a directory from an absolute path. Returns the absolute path, without the filename.

getEncoding.name: getEncoding
getEncoding.help: Returns the encoding (character set) of the Form or URL scope.

getException.name: getException
getException.help: Used with the cftry and cfcatch tags. Retrieves a Java exception object from a Java object.

getFileFromPath.name: getFileFromPath
getFileFromPath.help: Extracts a filename from an absolute path.

getFunctionList.name: getFunctionList
getFunctionList.help: Displays a list of the functions that are available in CFML.

getGatewayHelper.name: getGatewayHelper
getGatewayHelper.help: Gets a Java GatewayHelper object that provides methods and properties for use with a ColdFusion event gateway.

gatewayID.name: gatewayID
gatewayID.help: Identifier of the gateway that provides the GatewayHelper object.

getHTTPRequestData.name: getHTTPRequestData
getHTTPRequestData.help: Makes HTTP request headers and body available to CFML pages. Useful for capturing SOAP request data, which can be delivered in an HTTP header.

getHTTPTimeString.name: getHTTPTimeString
getHTTPTimeString.help: Gets the current time, in the Universal Time code (UTC).

getLocale.name: getLocale
getLocale.help: Gets the current geographic/language locale value. To set the default display format of date, time, number, and currency values in a CFML application session, you use the SetLocale function.

getLocaleDisplayName.name: getLocaleDisplayName
getLocaleDisplayName.help: Gets a locale value and displays the name in a manner that is appropriate to a specific locale. By default, gets the current locale in the current locale's language.

getLocalhostIP.name: getLocalhostIP
getLocalhostIP.help: Returns the localhost IP address, which is 127.0.0.1 for IPv4 and ::1 for IPv6 addresses.

getMetadata.name: getMetadata
getMetadata.help: Gets metadata (the methods, properties, and parameters of a component) associated with an object that is deployed on the CFML server.

getMetricData.name: getMetricData
getMetricData.help: Gets server performance metrics [mode - quicky] perf_monitor - Returns internal data, in a structure. simple_load - Returns an integer value that is computed from the state of the server's internal queues. Indicates the overall server load. prev_req_time - Returns the time, in milliseconds, that it took the server to process the previous request. avg_req_time - Returns the average time, in milliseconds, that it takes the server to process a request.

getPageContext.name: getPageContext
getPageContext.help: Gets the current CFML MX PageContext object that provides access to page attributes and configuration, request and response objects.

getProfileSections.name: getProfileSections
getProfileSections.help: Gets all the sections of an initialization file. An initialization file, as a struct whose format is as follows: - Each initialization file section name is a key in the struct - Each list of entries in a section of an initialization file is a value in the struct

getProfileString.name: getProfileString
getProfileString.help: Gets an initialization file entry. An initialization file assigns values to configuration variables, also known as entries, that are set when the system boots, the operating system comes up, or an application starts. Returns the entry - if no value, returns an empty string.

getSOAPRequest.name: getSOAPRequest
getSOAPRequest.help: Returns an XML object that contains the entire SOAP request. Usually called from within a web service CFC.

getSOAPRequestHeader.name: getSOAPRequestHeader
getSOAPRequestHeader.help: Obtains a SOAP request header. Call only from within a CFC web service function that is processing a request as a SOAP web service.

namespace.name: namespace
namespace.help: A String that is the namespace for the header

name.name: name
name.help: A String that is the name of the header

asXML.name: asXML
asXML.help: If True, the header is returned as a CFML XML object; if false (default), the header is returned as a Java object.

getSOAPResponse.name: getSOAPResponse
getSOAPResponse.help: Returns an XML object that contains the entire SOAP response after invoking a web service.

webservice.name: webservice
webservice.help: A webservice object as returned from the cfobject tag or the CreateObject function.

getSOAPResponseHeader.name: getSOAPResponseHeader
getSOAPResponseHeader.help: Returns a SOAP response header. Call this function from within code that is invoking a web service after making a web service request.

webservice.name: webservice
webservice.help: A webservice object as returned from the cfobject tag or the Createobject function.

namespace.name: namespace
namespace.help: A String that is the namespace for the header.

name.name: name
name.help: A String that is the name of the SOAP header.

asXML.name: asXML
asXML.help: If True, the header is returned as a CFML XML object; if false (default), the header is returned as a Java object.

getTempDirectory.name: getTempDirectory
getTempDirectory.help: Gets the path of the directory that CFML uses for temporary files. Before using this function in an application, test to determine the directory it returns under your account. Returns the absolute pathname of a directory, including a trailing slash.

getTempFile.name: getTempFile
getTempFile.help: Creates a temporary file in a directory whose name starts with (at most) the first three characters of prefix.

getTemplatePath.name: getTemplatePath
getTemplatePath.help: This function is deprecated.  Use the GetBaseTemplatePath function instead.

getTickCount.name: getTickCount
getTickCount.help: Returns the current value of an internal millisecond timer.

getTimezoneInfo.name: getTimezoneInfo
getTimezoneInfo.help: Gets local time zone information for the computer on which it is called, relative to Universal Time Coordinated (UTC). UTC is the mean solar time of the meridian of Greenwich, England.

getToken.name: getToken
getToken.help: Determines whether a token of the list in the delimiters parameter is present in a string. Returns the token found at position index of the string, as a string. If index is greater than the number of tokens in the string, returns an empty string.

getUserRoles.name: getUserRoles
getUserRoles.help: Retrieves the list of roles for the current user.

hash.name: hash
hash.help: Converts a variable-length string to a 32-byte, hexadecimal string, using the MD5 algorithm. (It is not possible to convert the hash result back to the source string.) 32-byte, hexadecimal string

encoding.name: encoding
encoding.help: A string specifying the encoding to use when converting the string to byte data used by the hash algorithm. Must be a character encoding name recognized by the Java runtime.

hour.name: hour
hour.help: Gets the current hour of the day. Ordinal value of the hour, in the range 0 - 23.

help._: Replaces special characters in a string with their HTML-escaped equivalents and inserts  tags at the beginning and end of the string. [version] HTML version to use. currently ignored. -1: The latest implementation of HTML 2.0: HTML 2.0 (Default) 3.2: HTML 3.2

htmlEditFormat.name: htmlEditFormat
htmlEditFormat.help: Replaces special characters in a string with their HTML-escaped equivalents. [version] HTML version to use. currently ignored. -1: The latest implementation of HTML 2.0: HTML 2.0 (Default) 3.2: HTML 3.2

iIf.name: iIf
iIf.help: Evaluates a Boolean conditional dynamic expression. Depending on whether the expression is true or false, dynamically evaluates one of two string expressions and returns the result.

incrementValue.name: incrementValue
incrementValue.help: Adds one to an integer. same as x=x+1 Why bother?

inputBaseN.name: inputBaseN
inputBaseN.help: Converts string, using the base specified by radix, to an integer. For example: #InputBaseN("3ff",16)#

insert.name: insert
insert.help: Inserts a substring in a string after a specified character position. If position = 0, prefixes the substring to the string.

int.name: int
int.help: Calculates the closest integer that is smaller than number.

isArray.name: isArray
isArray.help: Determines whether a value is an array. True, if value is an array, a query column object, or xml. also number = Dimension; function tests whether the array has exactly this dimension

isBinary.name: isBinary
isBinary.help: Determines whether a value is stored as binary data.

isBoolean.name: isBoolean
isBoolean.help: Determines whether a value can be converted to Boolean

isCustomFunction.name: isCustomFunction
isCustomFunction.help: Determines whether a name represents a custom function

isDate.name: isDate
isDate.help: Determines whether a string or Java object can be converted to a date/time value.

isDDX.name: isDDX
isDDX.help: Determines whether a DDX file exists and is valid, or if a string contains valid DDX instructions.

path.name: path
path.help: Pathname to the DDX file or a string of DDX instructions.

isDebugMode.name: isDebugMode
isDebugMode.help: Determines whether debugging output is enabled.

isInstanceOf.name: isInstanceOf
isInstanceOf.help: Determines whether an object is an instance of a Coldfusion interface or component, or of a Java class.

object.name: object
object.help: The CFC instance or Java object that you are testing

typename.name: typename
typename.help: The name of the interface, component, or Java class of which the object might be an instance

isJSON.name: isJSON
isJSON.help: Evaluates whether a string is in valid JSON (JavaScript Object Notation) data interchange format.

var.name: var
var.help: A string or variable that represents one.

isDefined.name: isDefined
isDefined.help: Evaluates a string value to determine whether the variable named in it exists.

isLeapYear.name: isLeapYear
isLeapYear.help: Determines whether a year is a leap year.

isLocalhost.name: isLocalhost
isLocalhost.help: Determines whether the specified IP address is the localhost.

isNumeric.name: isNumeric
isNumeric.help: Determines whether a string can be converted to a numeric value. Supports numbers in U.S. number format. For other number support use LSIsNumeric.

isNumericDate.name: isNumericDate
isNumericDate.help: Evaluates whether a real number is a valid representation of a date (date/time object).

isObject.name: isObject
isObject.help: Determines whether a value is an object. True, if the value represents a CFML object. False if the value is any other type of data, such as an integer, string, date, or struct.

isPDFFile.name: isPDFFile
isPDFFile.help: Verifies whether a PDF file is valid.

isPDFObject.name: isPDFObject
isPDFObject.help: Determines whether a value is a PDF object.

value.name: value
value.help: A value, typically the PDF object stored as a variable name.

isQuery.name: isQuery
isQuery.help: Determines whether value is a query.

isSimpleValue.name: isSimpleValue
isSimpleValue.help: Determines the type of a value.

isSOAPRequest.name: isSOAPRequest
isSOAPRequest.help: Determines whether a CFC is being called as a web service.

isStruct.name: isStruct
isStruct.help: Determines whether a variable is a structure. True, if variable is a CFML structure or is a Java object that implements the java.lang.Map interface. Returns False if the object in variable is a user-defined function (UDF).

isUserInRole.name: isUserInRole
isUserInRole.help: Determines whether an authenticated user belongs to the specified Role.

isUserLoggedIn.name: isUserLoggedIn
isUserLoggedIn.help: Determines whether a user is logged in.

isValid.name: isValid
isValid.help: Tests whether a value meets a validation or data type rule.

type.name: type
type.help: The valid format for the data.

value.name: value
value.help: The value to test.

min.name: min
min.help: The minimum valid value; used only for range validation.

max.name: max
max.help: The maximum valid value; used only for range validation.

pattern.name: pattern
pattern.help: A regular expression that the parameter must match; used only for regex or regular_expression validation.

isWDDX.name: isWDDX
isWDDX.help: Determines whether a value is a well-formed WDDX packet.

isXML.name: isXML
isXML.help: Determines whether a string is well-formed XML text.

value.name: value
value.help: A string containing the XML document text.

isXMLAttribute.name: isXMLAttribute
isXMLAttribute.help: Determines whether the function parameter is an XML Document Object Model (DOM) attribute node.

value.name: value
value.help: Name of an XML attribute.

isXMLDoc.name: isXMLDoc
isXMLDoc.help: Determines whether a function parameter is an Extended Markup language (XML) document object.

isXMLElem.name: isXMLElem
isXMLElem.help: Determines whether a function parameter is an Extended Markup language (XML) document object element.

isXMLNode.name: isXMLNode
isXMLNode.help: Determines whether the function parameter is an XML document object node.

value.name: value
value.help: Name of an XML document object node.

isXMLRoot.name: isXMLRoot
isXMLRoot.help: Determines whether a function parameter is the root element of an Extended Markup language (XML) document object.

javacast.name: javacast
javacast.help: Converts the data type of a CFML variable to pass as an argument to an overloaded method of a Java object. Use only for scalar and string arguments. [type - quicky] boolean,int,long,float,double,string

jsStringFormat.name: jsStringFormat
jsStringFormat.help: Escapes special JavaScript characters, such as single quotation mark, double quotation mark, and newline

lCase.name: lCase
lCase.help: Converts the alphabetic characters in a string to lowercase.

left.name: left
left.help: Returns the leftmost count characters in a string.

len.name: len
len.help: Determines the length of a string or binary object

listAppend.name: listAppend
listAppend.help: Concatenates a list or element to a list.

value.name: value
value.help: An element or a list of elements.

listChangeDelims.name: listChangeDelims
listChangeDelims.help: Changes a list delimiter. Returns a copy of the list, with each delimiter character replaced by new_delimiter.

listContains.name: listContains
listContains.help: Determines the index of the first list element that contains a specified substring. Returns the index of the first list element that contains substring. If not found, returns zero.

listContainsNoCase.name: listContainsNoCase
listContainsNoCase.help: Determines the index of the first list element that contains a specified substring.

listDeleteAt.name: listDeleteAt
listDeleteAt.help: Deletes an element from a list. Returns a copy of the list, without the specified element.

listFind.name: listFind
listFind.help: Determines the index of the first list element in which a specified value occurs. Case-sensitive

listFindNoCase.name: listFindNoCase
listFindNoCase.help: Determines the index of the first list element in which a specified value occurs

listFirst.name: listFirst
listFirst.help: Gets the first element of a list.

listGetAt.name: listGetAt
listGetAt.help: Gets a list element at a specified position.

listInsertAt.name: listInsertAt
listInsertAt.help: Inserts an element in a list.

listLast.name: listLast
listLast.help: Gets the last element of a list.

listLen.name: listLen
listLen.help: Determines the number of elements in a list.

listPrepend.name: listPrepend
listPrepend.help: Inserts an element at the beginning of a list.

listQualify.name: listQualify
listQualify.help: Inserts a string at the beginning and end of list elements.

listRest.name: listRest
listRest.help: Gets a list, without its first element.

listSetAt.name: listSetAt
listSetAt.help: Replaces the contents of a list element.

listSort.name: listSort
listSort.help: Sorts list elements according to a sort type and sort order. Returns a sorted copy of the list. [sort_type - quicky] numeric: sorts numbers text: sorts text alphabetically, taking case into account - aabzABZ, if sort_order = "asc" - ZBAzbaa, if sort_order = "desc" textnocase: sorts text alphabetically, without regard to case - aAaBbBzzZ, in an asc sort; - ZzzBbBaAa, in a desc sort;

localSensitive.name: localSensitive
localSensitive.help: Performs locale sensitive sort, if tyue. Default is false

listToArray.name: listToArray
listToArray.help: Copies the elements of a list to an array.

multiCharacterDelimiter.name: multiCharacterDelimiter
multiCharacterDelimiter.help: A Boolean value specifying whether the delimiters parameter specifies a multi-character delimiter.

listValueCount.name: listValueCount
listValueCount.help: Counts instances of a specified value in a list. The search is case-sensitive.

listValueCountNoCase.name: listValueCountNoCase
listValueCountNoCase.help: Counts instances of a specified value in a list. The search is case-insensitive.

lJustify.name: lJustify
lJustify.help: Left justifies characters in a string of a specified length.

location.name: location
location.help: Stops execution of the current page and opens a CFML page or HTML file.

url.name: url
url.help: URL of HTML file or CFML page to open.

log.name: log
log.help: Calculates the natural logarithm of a number. Natural logarithms are based on the constant e (2.71828182845904).

log10.name: log10
log10.help: Calculates the logarithm of number, to base 10.

lsCurrencyFormat.name: lsCurrencyFormat
lsCurrencyFormat.help: Formats a number in a locale-specific currency format. For countries that use the euro, the result depends on the JVM. [type - quicky] local: the currency format and currency symbol used locally. - With JDK 1.3, the default for Euro Zone: local currency. - With JDK 1.4, the default for Euro Zone: euro. international: the international standard currency format none: the local currency format; no currency symbol

lsDateFormat.name: lsDateFormat
lsDateFormat.help: Formats the date part of a date/time value in a locale-specific format. [mask - quicky] d,dd,ddd,dddd: Day of month / week m,mm,mmm,mmmm: Month; y,yy,yyyy: Year; gg: Period/era string short / medium / long / full

lsEuroCurrencyFormat.name: lsEuroCurrencyFormat
lsEuroCurrencyFormat.help: Formats a number in a locale-specific currency format. [type - quicky] local: the currency format used in the locale. (Default.) international: the international standard currency format none: the currency format used; no currency symbol

lsIsCurrency.name: lsIsCurrency
lsIsCurrency.help: Determines whether a string is a valid representation of a currency amount in the current locale.

lsIsDate.name: lsIsDate
lsIsDate.help: Determines whether a string is a valid representation of a date/time value in the current locale.

lsIsNumeric.name: lsIsNumeric
lsIsNumeric.help: Determines whether a string is a valid representation of a number in the current locale.

isNull.name: isNull
isNull.help: Determines whether given object is null or not

lsNumberFormat.name: lsNumberFormat
lsNumberFormat.help: Formats a number in a locale-specific format. [mask - quicky] _,9 Digit placeholder; . decimal point; 0 Pads with zeros; ( ) less than zero, puts parentheses around the mask + plus sign before positive number minus before negative - a space before positive minus sign before negative , Separates every third decimal place with a comma. L,C Left-justifies or center-justifies number $ dollar sign before formatted number. ^ Separates left and right formatting.

locale.name: locale
locale.help: Locale to be used for formatting

lsParseCurrency.name: lsParseCurrency
lsParseCurrency.help: Converts a locale-specific currency string into a formatted number. Attempts conversion by comparing the string with each the three supported currency formats (none, local, international) and using the first that matches.

lsParseDateTime.name: lsParseDateTime
lsParseDateTime.help: Converts a string that is a valid date/time representation in the current locale into a date/time object.

format.name: format
format.help: Format for parsing the date, as supported in Java

lsParseEuroCurrency.name: lsParseEuroCurrency
lsParseEuroCurrency.help: Formats a locale-specific currency string as a number. Attempts conversion through each of the default currency formats (none, local, international). Ensures correct handling of euro currency for Euro zone countries.

lsParseNumber.name: lsParseNumber
lsParseNumber.help: Converts a string that is a valid numeric representation in the current locale into a formatted number.

lsTimeFormat.name: lsTimeFormat
lsTimeFormat.help: Formats the time part of a date/time string into a string in a locale-specific format. [mask - quicky] h,hh,H,HH: Hours; m,mm: Minutes; s,ss: Seconds; l: Milliseconds; t: A or P; tt: AM or PM "short" = h:mm tt; "medium" = h:mm:ss tt

lTrim.name: lTrim
lTrim.help: Removes leading spaces from a string.

max.name: max
max.help: Determines the greater of two numbers.

mid.name: mid
mid.help: Extracts a substring from a string.

String.name: String
String.help: The string from which the substring will be extracted.

start.name: start
start.help: The position of the first character to retrieve.

count.name: count
count.help: The number of characters to retrieve.

min.name: min
min.help: Determines the lesser of two numbers.

minute.name: minute
minute.help: Extracts the minute value from a date/time object.

month.name: month
month.help: Extracts the month value from a date/time object.

monthAsString.name: monthAsString
monthAsString.help: Determines the name of the month that corresponds to month_number.

month_number.name: month_number
month_number.help: An integer in the range 1 â€“ 12.

locale.name: locale
locale.help: Locale to use instead of the locale of the page when processing the function

now.name: now
now.help: Gets the current date and time of the computer running the CFML server.

numberFormat.name: numberFormat
numberFormat.help: Creates a custom-formatted number value. For international number formatting use LSNumberFormat. [mask - quicky] _,9 Digit placeholder; . decimal point; 0 Pads with zeros; ( ) less than zero, puts parentheses around the mask + plus sign before positive number minus before negative - a space before positive minus sign before negative , Separates every third decimal place with a comma. L,C Left-justifies or center-justifies number $ dollar sign before formatted number. ^ Separates left and right formatting.

paragraphFormat.name: paragraphFormat
paragraphFormat.help:
Replaces characters in a string: * Single newline characters (CR/LF sequences) with spaces * Double newline characters with HTML paragraph tags (

)

parseDateTime.name: parseDateTime
parseDateTime.help: Parses a date/time string according to the English (U.S.) locale conventions. (To format a date/time string for other locales, use the LSParseDateTime function.)

styleOrFormat.name: styleOrFormat
styleOrFormat.help: - standard: (the default) function does no conversion. - pop: specifies that the date/time string is in POP format, which includes the local time of the sender and a time-zone offset from UTC. ColdFusion applies the offset and returns a value with the UTC time. - Or custom Date format as supported in Java

pi.name: pi
pi.help: Gets the mathematical constant p, accurate to 15 digits. The number 3.14159265358979.

precisionEvaluate.name: precisionEvaluate
precisionEvaluate.help: Evaluates one or more string expressions.

preserveSingleQuotes.name: preserveSingleQuotes
preserveSingleQuotes.help: Prevents CFML from automatically escaping single quotation mark characters that are contained in a variable. CFML does not evaluate the argument.  Note: ColdFusion automatically escapes simple-variable, array-variable, and structure-variable references within a cfquery tag body or block.

variable.name: variable
variable.help: Variable that contains a string in which to preserve single quotation marks.

quarter.name: quarter
quarter.help: Calculates the quarter of the year in which a date falls.

queryAddColumn.name: queryAddColumn
queryAddColumn.help: Adds a column to a query and populates its rows with the contents of a one-dimensional array. Pads query columns, if necessary, to ensure that all columns have the same number of rows.

queryAddRow.name: queryAddRow
queryAddRow.help: Adds a specified number of empty rows to a query.

rowData.name: rowData
rowData.help: Could be numeric, Struct or array of Struct

columnlist.name: columnlist
columnlist.help: A string or a variable that contains one. Delimited list of column names, or an empty string.

columntypelist.name: columntypelist
columntypelist.help: Comma-delimited list specifying column data types.

rowData.name: rowData
rowData.help: Row data as Struct or array of Struct

querySetCell.name: querySetCell
querySetCell.help: Sets a cell to a value. If no row number is specified, the cell on the last row is set.

quotedValueList.name: quotedValueList
quotedValueList.help: Gets the values of each record returned from an executed query. CFML does not evaluate the arguments

rand.name: rand
rand.help: Generates a pseudo-random number in the range 0 - 1.

algorithm.name: algorithm
algorithm.help: The algorithm to use to generated the random number.

randomize.name: randomize
randomize.help: Seeds the pseudo-random number generator with an integer number, ensuring repeatable number patterns.

algorithm.name: algorithm
algorithm.help: The algorithm to use to generated the random number.

randRange.name: randRange
randRange.help: Generates a random integer between two specified numbers. Requests for random integers that are greater than 100,000,000 result in non-random numbers, to prevent overflow during internal computations.

algorithm.name: algorithm
algorithm.help: The algorithm to use to generated the random number.

reFind.name: reFind
reFind.help: Uses a regular expression (RE) to search a string for a pattern. The search is case sensitive.

reg_expression.name: reg_expression
reg_expression.help: Regular expression for which to search. Case sensitive.

String.name: String
String.help: A string or a variable that contains one. String in which to search.

start.name: start
start.help: A positive integer, or a variable that contains one. Position in the string at which to start search. The default value is 1.

returnsubexpressions.name: returnsubexpressions
returnsubexpressions.help: True: if the regular expression is found, the first array element contains the length and position, respectively, of the first match. If the regular expression contains parentheses that group subexpressions, each subsequent array element contains the length and position, respectively, of the first occurrence of each group. If the regular expression is not found, the arrays each contain one element with the value 0. False: the function returns the position in the string where the match begins. Default.

reFindNoCase.name: reFindNoCase
reFindNoCase.help: Uses a regular expression (RE) to search a string for a pattern, starting from a specified position. The search is case-insensitive.

String.name: String
String.help: A string or a variable that contains one. String in which to search.

returnsubexpressions.name: returnsubexpressions
returnsubexpressions.help: True: if the regular expression is found, the first array element contains the length and position, respectively, of the first match. If the regular expression contains parentheses that group subexpressions, each subsequent array element contains the length and position, respectively, of the first occurrence of each group. If the regular expression is not found, the arrays each contain one element with the value 0. False: the function returns the position in the string where the match begins. Default.

reMatch.name: reMatch
reMatch.help: Uses a regular expression (RE) to search a string for a pattern, starting from a specified position.

reg_expression.name: reg_expression
reg_expression.help: Regular expression for which to search. Case sensitive.

string.name: string
string.help: A string or a variable that contains one. String in which to search.

reMatchNoCase.name: reMatchNoCase
reMatchNoCase.help: Uses a regular expression (RE) to search a string for a pattern, starting from a specified position.

reg_expression.name: reg_expression
reg_expression.help: Regular expression for which to search. Case insensitive.

string.name: string
string.help: A string or a variable that contains one. String in which to search.

releaseCOMObject.name: releaseCOMObject
releaseCOMObject.help: Releases a COM Object and frees up resources that it used.

repeatString.name: repeatString
repeatString.help: Creates a string that contains a specified number of repetitions of the specified string.

replace.name: replace
replace.help: Replaces occurrences of substring1 in a string with substring2, in a specified scope. The search is case-sensitive.

scope.name: scope
scope.help: * one: replace the first occurrence (default) * all: replace all occurrences

replaceList.name: replaceList
replaceList.help: Replaces occurrences of the elements from a delimited list in a string with corresponding elements from another delimited list. The search is case sensitive.

delimiter2.name: delimiter2
delimiter2.help: Delimeter for the string which is used for replacing the characters in input string

replaceNoCase.name: replaceNoCase
replaceNoCase.help: Replaces occurrences of substring1 with substring2, in the specified scope. The search is case-insensitive.

String.name: String
String.help: A string (or variable that contains one) within which to replace substring

scope.name: scope
scope.help: * one: Replace the first occurrence (default) * all: Replace all occurrences

reReplace.name: reReplace
reReplace.help: Uses a regular expression (RE) to search a string for a string pattern and replace it with another. The search is case-sensitive.

String.name: String
String.help: A string or a variable that contains one

substring.name: substring
substring.help: A string or a variable that contains one. Replaces reg_expression

scope.name: scope
scope.help: * one: Replace the first occurrence of the regular expression. Default. * all: Replace all occurrences of the regular expression.

reReplaceNoCase.name: reReplaceNoCase
reReplaceNoCase.help: Uses a regular expression to search a string for a string pattern and replace it with another. The search is case-insensitive.

String.name: String
String.help: A string or a variable that contains one

substring.name: substring
substring.help: A string or a variable that contains one. Replaces reg_expression

scope.name: scope
scope.help: * one: Replace the first occurrence of the regular expression. Default. * all: Replace all occurrences of the regular expression.

reverse.name: reverse
reverse.help: Reverses the order of items, such as the characters in a string, the digits in a number, or the elements in an array.

String.name: String
String.help: A string or a variable that contains one

right.name: right
right.help: Gets a specified number of characters from a string, beginning at the right.

count.name: count
count.help: A positive integer or a variable that contains one. Number of characters to return.

rJustify.name: rJustify
rJustify.help: Right justifies characters of a string.

round.name: round
round.help: Rounds a number to the closest integer.

rTrim.name: rTrim
rTrim.help: Removes spaces from the end of a string.

String.name: String
String.help: A string or a variable that contains one

second.name: second
second.help: Extracts the ordinal for the second from a date/time object.

sendGatewayMessage.name: sendGatewayMessage
sendGatewayMessage.help: Sends an outgoing message through a ColdFusion MX event gateway.

gatewayID.name: gatewayID
gatewayID.help: Identifier of the gateway to send the message.

serializeJSON.name: serializeJSON
serializeJSON.help: Converts ColdFusion data into a JSON (JavaScript Object Notation) representation of the data.

obj.name: obj
obj.help: A ColdFusion data value or variable that represents one.

usecustomserializer.name: usecustomserializer
usecustomserializer.help: Whether to use the customSerializer or not. The default value is true. Always the custom serializer will be used for serialization. If specified false, the JSON serialization will be done using the default ColdFusion behaviour.

serialize.name: serialize
serialize.help: Serializes the object to specified type..

type.name: type
type.help: Type to which the object will be serialized

scopevar.help: Life span, as a real number of days, of the application, including all Application scope variables. Use the CFML CreateTimeSpan function to generate this variableâ€™s value.

scopevar.help: autogenmap=true|false - Specifies whether ColdFusion should automatically generate mapping for the persistent CFCs. If autogenmap=false, mapping should be provided in the form of .HBMXML files.

scopevar.name: cacheconfig
scopevar.help: Specifies the location of the configuration file that should be used by the secondary cache provider.This setting is used only when secondarycacheenabled=true.

scopevar.name: cacheprovider
scopevar.help: Specifies the cache provider that should be used by ORM as secondary cache. The values can be: 						    * Ehcache 						    * JBossCache 						    * Hashtable 						    * SwarmCache 						    * OSCache  Fully qualified name of the class for any other cache provider.  This setting is used only when secondarycacheenabled=true

If cfclocation is set, ColdFusion looks at only the paths specified in it. If it is not set, ColdFusion looks at the application directory, its sub-directories, and its mapped directories to search for persistent CFCs.

scopevar.name: datasource
scopevar.help: Specifies the data source that should be used by ORM. If it is not specified here, then the data source specified for the application is picked up.

scopevar.name: dbcreate
scopevar.help: ColdFusion ORM can automatically create the tables for your application in the database when ORM is initialized for the application. This can be enabled by using dbcreate in ormsettings. dbCreate takes the following values: 						    * update: Setting this value creates the table if it does not exist or update the table if it exists. * dropcreate: Setting this value drops the table if it exists and then creates it. * none (default): Setting this value does not change anything in the database schema.

scopevar.name: dialect
scopevar.help: Specifies the dialect.

scopevar.name: eventHandling
scopevar.help: eventHandling=true|false - Specifies whether ORM Event callbacks should be given.

scopevar.name: flushatrequestend
scopevar.help: flushatrequestend=true|false - Specifies whether ormflush should be called automatically at request end. If flushatrequestend is false, ormflush is not called automatically at request end.

scopevar.name: logSQL
scopevar.help: logSQL=true|false - Specifies whether the SQL queries that are executed by ORM will be logged. If LogSQL=true, the SQL queries are logged to the console.

scopevar.name: ormconfig
